DESCRIPTION:
Part of the prestigious Fine & Rare series from The Macallan, this 52-year-old expression was distilled in 1950 and was bottled in from a single second fill sherry cask #600 in 2002. This bottle is an impressive vintage and comes with a smart wooden presentation case.  Presented at a strength of 51.7% abv.  
Unique Ref:- m21prj
Signed and dated by N Mackellar - 21/12/04
This lot comes with a hand made crystal glass designed for The Macallan malt whisky. It is based upon the 18th Century Jacobite original in the Victoria & Albert Museum in London.
To top it all off, it also comes with a First Edition of "The definitive guide to buying vintage Macallan.

This is a beautiful bottle of 1952 vintage Macallan. It was distilled in 1952 and aged in single Sherry cask #1250, for an impressive 49 years, before being bottled in 2002 at 48% ABV. This bottle is an impressive vintage release from The Macallan Fine & Rare series. It comes with a smart wooden presentation case.

A great chance to be the new owner of a 24 Year Old Tobermory Single Malt Cask, held in bond at Deanston.
Filled on the 22nd November 1995, cask #1749 has been maturing very nicely and was re-gauged in November of this year, 2019.
There a few key facts and figures that have been listed below for your attention -
If bottled at cask strength and at 70cl, this cask would approximately yield 247 bottles of 24 year old Tobermory. 
Unofficial Tasting Notes
Nose: @ Cask Strength - Citrus, lemon zest of fresh oak & very faint nutmeg.
Nose: @ 20% - Oak - Fresh nutmet, citrus is slightly clouded by oak but it is in the background.
Palate: Oak, Spice, Citrus - tangerine zest. 
Finish: Slightly spicy.
Please Note -
Should the new owner be a UK revenue trader (business), registration with HMRC is required and they must hold a WOWGR certificate.
A revenue trader outside the UK, will need a Duty Representative in the UK (Note: Annual charge will most likely apply)

This is a beautiful bottle of 1985 vintage Macallan. It was distilled in 1985 and aged in single Sherry cask #190413, for an impressive 29 years, before being bottled in 2014 at 46.8% ABV. This bottle is an impressive vintage release from The Macallan Fine & Rare series. It comes with a smart wooden presentation case.
Unique Reference: nhx1e7
Signed and dated on by M Bennett 13/3/17.

This is a beautiful bottle of 1990 vintage Macallan. It was distilled in 1990 and aged in single Sherry cask #24706, for an impressive 22 years, before being bottled in 2013 at 58.2% ABV. This bottle is an impressive vintage release from The Macallan Fine & Rare series. It comes with a smart wooden presentation case.
Unique Reference: U3bjq9
Signed and dated on  by . M.Bennett 6/3/17

Folio 1: The first edition from The Macallan Archival Series.  This 2015 distillery exclusive release is presented in a beautiful book shaped tin.  It was limited to less than 2000 bottles of 12 year old single malt with an ABV of 43%.  It comes with a hardback book that presents 80's Macallan advertisement pictures along with a USB stick of Macallan advertising archive.
Folio 2:  The second edition from The Macallan Archival Series.  This distillery exclusive bottle was released in 2017 and was limited to 2000 bottles. This 12 year old single malt that had been matured in sherry casks and bottled at 43% ABV.  Presented in a book-shaped tin case and comes with a hardback book which revisits The Macallan's original print, press & film advertising campaign from 1980-1994.  The front image is a water-colour painted by artist Sara Midd.
Folio 3: The third expression in the Archival Series from The Macallan, this distillery exclusive bottling was released in 2018, and limited to just 2,000 bottles. The bottle and book-shaped presentation tin showcase a campaign that celebrated the idea that whisky is best made in cold weather, with two people playing on the snow-covered slopes of Ben Rinnes.
Folio 4: The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan.  Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland. It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case.  It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927).  The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rankin 30 Year Old Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION:
The Masters of Photography series took the whisky world with a little bit of surprise. 
Macallan released this limited edition series of photographs to be paired with their Macallan 30-year-old fine oak.  
All of the photographs were taken on-site and across one summer season.
The label varies but some features scenery, staff, equipment, wash backs and stills.
1,000 bottles and photographs were chosen and each box contains one of the original photographs.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 1981 Single Cask Feis Ile 2008
DESCRIPTION:
One of the rarest Port Ellens? Quite possibly, due to the fact it is only single cask bottling from the distillery.
An official bottling released for Feis Ile in 2008 selling out instantly.
Distilled on 15th April 1981 and bottled in 2008 this is an ex-refill American oak cask #1301.
Only 220 bottles were produced.
This is bottle number 25.

One of the best and most iconic whiskies from The Macallan and Easter Elchies house. Within the crystal decanter, a sherry matured whisky showcasing why the distillery is a world leader.
Designed by Fabien Baron, this would be a great addition to the collection of any Macallan fan.

Part of the prestigious Fine & Rare series from The Macallan, this 52-year-old expression was distilled in 1950 and was bottled in from a single second fill sherry cask #600 in 2002. This bottle is an impressive vintage and comes with a smart wooden presentation case.  Presented at a strength of 51.7% abv.  
Unique ID: NBU2P5

This vintage from Macallan was distilled in 1980 and bottled in 1999. The Gran Reserva bottlings were released in 1997 all the way through to 2002.
Regarded as one of the most recognisable whiskies in the world today.
Looking to start a collection? Look no further...
An old bottling Bowmore from the days before the distillery was sold to Stanley P Morrison. We estimate this bottle dates from the 1970s.

This vintage Macallan 18 Year Old is from 1974.  The single malt has been matured for 18 years in Sherry Oak casks handpicked and made in Jerez, Spain.
Bottled around 1992, the packaging of this bottle is iconic - the purple sashed box features Sara Midda's lovely watercolours of the iconic Easter Elchies house.

This Macallan is very collectable and highly acclaimed.
It was distilled in 1973 but previously had been stored in sherry wood casks.
This 18 year old rare and collectable is hugely sought after.

This Macallan is very collectable and highly acclaimed.
It was distilled in 1976 but previously had been stored in sherry wood casks.
This 18 year old rare and collectable is hugely sought after.

A stunning vintage and one of the rarest bottlings from Tains Glenmorangie. It was distilled in 1963 and matured for 22 years in bourbon casks.
To top it all off....it spent some time in Oloroso sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 13 Year Old 1992 - Single Cask - Feis Ile 2005
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare Laphroaig released at Laphroaig distillery during Feis Ile 2005. 
Cask 228 filled on 16th January 1992 and only 170 bottles were produced.
The more recent festival releases have much larger bottle numbers.

Available only on the beautiful Island of Islay at Laphroaig distillery/website.
30 year old Cairdeas release is a combination of around 60% sherry casks and 40% bourbon casks.
Before being bottled they were merged in bourbon casks before bottling.
This special bottling is one of 1,536 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 36 Year Old - Canasta Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This limited-edition Bunnahabhain Canasta 1980 was matured in oloroso sherry casks before a finishing period in sweet Canasta sherry casks. It comes with a striking presentation box.  This is one of just 1200 bottles produced.
The result is a complex and many-layered whisky, with Bunnahabhain's oily and fruity spirit character carefully combined with dried fruit, treacle and chocolate notes.
This luxurious 40-Year-Old single malt comes in a stunning presentation box.  It was has matured for 40 years in 'Turney casks.'

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This Highland single malt from the closed distillery, Brora, is 24 years old and bottled at cask strength (56.1%)
This is bottle number 5672

The Macallan Folio 3 is a limited edition that was released exclusively at the Macallan Distillery in 2018.  It is the third release in the Folio series.
The theme of the Folio 3 is Macallan's advertising campaigns from the 1980s and 1990s.  The presentation includes a book containing the best of these.  The illustration on the box is from an advert used in a Victorian-era edition of Punch Magazine.  It is intended to capture the sentiment that whisky is best produced in cold weather - a remark that Macallan claim was made on their very own estate at Easter Elchies.
As with the previous Folio releases, the bottle is presented in an elegant book-shaped tin box.

The start of this series began in 1982 and quite possibly the most recognisable malt in the world, The Macallan 18 Year Old. The 18 year old in the tube packaging is one of 6 releases of this kind, depicting Sara Middletons view of the estate on the front.
Distilled in Speyside, within touching distance of Easter Elchies house and fully matured in Sherry oak cask from Jerez, Spain.
This malt was distilled in 1985 and subsequently bottled in 2003.

Limited to only 201 bottles, from a single cask, this bottling of single malt was distilled at The Macallan Distillery.
The spirit ran from stills in June 1993 and was matured for 26 years before bottling. 
Finished in a single fresh Oloroso Sherry cask, this has "endowed the liquid with exceptional taste and complexity."
Tasting notes by David Boyd:Colour: Old Gold.Nose: Rich sherry, toffee, stewed fruit and vanilla accompany hints of lemon citrus and orange peel.Taste: Exceptionally smooth, rich and oily. Notes of warm spicy oak, stewed fruit, raisins and a delicate nuttiness.Finish: Full-bodied and long with subtle hints of sherry and anise.

Originally released around the year 2000, this beautifully packaged Laphroig 30-year-old comes in a striking wooden presentation box.  It is an Islay gem that is becoming rarer and rarer.
Only a few releases from the distillery have been of an age older than this since its release. 
Awards include double Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.

The Brora 35 Year Old was released in 2013 from the now-closed distillery in the Highlands.
This is part of the annual release and is a great age.
With the distillery reopening in full swing, could this bottle become even more sought after as time goes on?
This is bottle number 1492

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 25 Year Old - Lord of the Isles
DESCRIPTION:
An iconic Ardbeg, named after the 'Lord of the Isles' who ruled the Western Isles and parts of Argyll between the 12th and 15th Century. 
This limited edition 25-year-old was released between 2002 and 2007.

This is a very collectable bottling from Ardbeg, released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018. It was distilled in April 2005 and filled into an Oloroso sherry butt, where it aged until April 2018. This is one of just 543 individually numbered bottles released.
This is bottle number 352 & has been signed by distillery manager.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2018 Black edition was released in 2018.  Only 1,958 limited edition bottles were drawn from the casks.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.2% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

Hand-selected for Selfridges this cask yielded 200 bottles. Distilled in 2012 and bottled in 2019 from a 2nd refill hogshead, this hyped dram is uncoloured and chill-filtered.
The cask is ex Hanyu before being taken into the care of Chichibu.
Notes: Baked apple, with a creamy, rich layer of Hazelnuts.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
Glenfarclas SMWS 40 Year Old 1.127 is a great age and a great year, being distilled in 1965.
Bottled in 2005 this is incredibly still at good strength of 55.5%.
"Bubble gum in the boudoir"

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old Woodland Estate Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
A 12 year old sherry matured limited edition Macallan. Each bottle has been given a number which corresponds to a tree that has been numbered and subsequently planted in the ground. 
It was made available from the distillery in the 2000s.
One of only 1,000 bottles. 
This is bottle number 140

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

Swamp Oak Single Cask has a great story to go with the name.
Bottled in September 2005 from cask number 1946. The cask was distilled and laid down in May 1993.
Bill Lumsden started to experiment with different oak casks. Some successful and some...well not so much. This was definitely one of the successful ones. Others include Missouri, Truffle, Poat and Burr Oak. 
Only 247 bottles came from this outturn and it was the lowest amount of the series. 
During shipment, the bottles were LOST!! Some years later they were found and returned to the distillery.

From the heart of Campletown this 21 year old Springbank is a real throwback. 
Distilled in 1972, this bottling was matured for 21 years and bottled in 1993.

Matured in the famous banks of Bowmores shores at the No1 Vaults, this 30 Year old Bowmore was matured in an exclusive Bourbon cask.
Bottled, 30th April 2014 at cask strength and distilled on the 24th April 1984.
This bottle has steadily been increasing in value since its release.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

This is a very collectable bottling from Ardbeg, released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2019. It was distilled in 2003 and bottled straight from Chenin Blanc cask #2455. This is one of just 231 individually numbered bottles released.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 41 Year Old - 1978 Single Cask #11002
DESCRIPTION: This is a beautifully presented limited edition single Highland malt from Glen Garioch.  It was distilled in 1978, matured in refill bourbon barrel #11002 for 41 years and was bottled in August 2019 at 55.1% ABV. This is one of only 180 bottles.

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This distillery, however, is quite special as it contributed to 13 different rare Malt selection releases. Matured for 20 years, this bottle was distilled in 1975.
These Brora bottles are becoming very sought after. 
This is bottle number 780.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Booker's - 25th Anniversary Edition 10 Year Old Small Batch Bourbon
DESCRIPTION:
This bourbon is very rare even if it is only 10 years old and bottled at cask strength. This bottling was a special commemorative release to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the Booker's brand.
A subsidiary company of Jim Beam, Booker's was named after former master distiller, Booker Noe.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: St. Magdalene - 23 Year Old 1970 - Rare Malts Selection
DESCRIPTION: This 23 Year Old St. Magdalene was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.43% as part of the Rare Malts Selection.  It was distilled in 1970, using the traditional direct-fired stills. The distillery sadly closed in the 1980s. This is a collectable bottling.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 1975 Cote de Nuits Wood Finish 25 YO
DESCRIPTION:
A somewhat scarce and rare Glenmorangie, distilled in 1975, it was  matured in bourbon casks before being finished in Cote de Nuit Burgundy Grand Cru casks.
This bottle bottle achieved a somehwat legendary status among the whisky community.
Bottle number 913

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 10 Year Old Cask Strength - 1 Litre 58.8%
DESCRIPTION:
The much loved 10 year old Macallan bottled at its cask strength - 58.8%.
Matured in Sherry Oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
The very recognisable Easter Elchie house depicted on the front of the box painted by Sara Middleton.

A Highland Park bottled in October 1973 and is a sister cask release. This was originally an experiment which showcases just how much change that can happen in a cask. Both casks were filled, matured for 28 years.
They were both bottled on the 22nd February 2001.
This is Cask #11167 and yielded 524 bottles. 
This is bottle number 167.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The second release for the Islay festival Feis Ile in 2008. It was distilled on the 13th of April 1993 and bottled in 2008.
This Lagavulin Cask is #1403 was selected by Iain McArthur.

Now known as Diageo, this Aberfeldy is part of the Manager’s Dram series. 
The whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of the company and were selected by the respective distillery managers. All of the bottles were distilled and bottled at natural cask strength.
This particular bottling was released in 1991 and had been matured in sherry casks.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

The Macallan Easter Elchies 2019 Black edition was released in late 2019.  It was bottled with natural colour at 49.7% ABV.  The release celebrates the distillery’s ‘spiritual home’ at the heart of the Macallan Estate.

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hanyu - 2000 Ichiro’s Malt 15 Year Old - The Final Vintage
DESCRIPTION:
A rare and exciting bottling of 15 year old Hanyu Japanese single malt whisky. It was distilled in 2000, aged for 15 years, and bottled at 46.5% ABV as part of the Ichiro's Malt range from stocks acquired by Ichiro Akuto after Hanyu closed down in 2000.
Only 3,710 bottle of this whisky was produced and it was aptly dubbed The Final Vintage of Hanyu.

A single-cask 1972 vintage Glenmorangie. Aged for more than two decades in cask 1657 then bottled in March 1994.
This is bottle number 82.

A rather rare Longmorn bottle which was commissioned in order to commemorate a centenary of the distillery in 1995.
Employees and only a selected few were given this bottle, thus it adds to how rare it is because it was never made available to the general public.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 30 Year Old - The Ian Hunter Story - Book 1
DESCRIPTION: This is a 30 year old cask strength bottling from the 1987 vintage. This bottle forms the first chapter to the story of Ian Hunter and celebrates the man who introduced the iconic American white Oak barrels to the whisky making at Laphroaig. It is said that it was Ian who made Laphroaig what it is today.

This well-aged Glen Grant was specially bottled to celebrate Gordon & MacPhail being awarded The Queen's Award for Enterprise for International Trade and was given to staff.  Distilled in June 1965, it was matured in a first-fill sherry cask and was bottled in August 2009.  
This back label of this has been signed.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - Smugglers' Series - The Complete Trilogy
Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Original Cask Strength 57.3%
DESCRIPTION:
A nice and stiff 57.3% cask strength 10 year old from Islay. 
The cask strength expression is said to be the best way to experience the rugged character.
Or...straight from the wood as they say!

A 1987 vintage Glenmorangie, specially selected by the distillery manager. Aged for just over 10 years in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in a single port pipe for 35 months. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 57.2% in May 2001. This bottle comes with a striking wooden presentation box.

Macallan Cask Strength bottlings are one of the most popular bottles in the history of whisky... arguably.
Bottled at full proof which can also be understood to be 57%.

This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date (minus 1), comprising of Edition no.2, 3 ,4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

A limited edition 32 Year Old Tobermory from 1972, finished in Oloroso sherry casks for a deliciously rich sweetness. Bottled in 2005, this is one of just 1710 individually numbered bottles produced.  This single malt, from the only distillery on the Island of Mull, was bottled at its natural cask strength of 49.5%.
Comes with box and certificate. 
This is bottle number 941 of just 1710 individually numbered bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Whisky Maker's Edition - Classic Travel Range - 4 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes the 1920's locomotive, the 1930's propeller plane, the 1930's ocean liner and the 1940's roadster. 
The range includes a set of 4 different bottle labels and outer boxes, with x-ray photography celebrating the art of travel, designed by Nick Veasey.
Released for the travel retail market, this single malt is part of The Macallan Whisky Maker's Edition Classic Travel Range.  It was crafted by Bob Dalgarno, Macallan's distillery manager, using whisky drawn from a combination of Sherry and bourbon casks.  It is bottled at his preferred strength of 42.8%.

The London Edition (2019) from the Chichibu Distillery in Japan was bottled at 48.5%.  It was an exclusive distillery bottling for the Whisky Show.  
This is one of 1405 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 763.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Bicentenary Repatriation Japanese Edition 1977
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park Bicentenary release certainly has a great story behind it.
In 1997 it was thought to be sold out but in a warehouse, in Japan, hundreds of the bottles were discovered. 
This was re-released in 2008 and this is one of 690 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.

This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release, from the home of the legendary No. Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Oban Manager’s Dram 1995 - 19 Years old.
Part of the Manager’s Dram series bottled for the employees of Diageo, as it is now known.
A selection process was done by each distillery manager on rotation and was bottled at cask strength. John William chose this cask, it was bottled in 1995 from a refill cask.

This limited edition bottling from the Highland distillery Glengoyne was distilled on Christmas day in 1967. It is one of 2500 individually numbered bottles that were produced and bottled in August 1992.
 
This is bottle number 1738.
This 40 year old Glenfarclas has the generous sherried notes the distillery is famous for.  It comes in an eye-catching box reminiscent of the iconic doors of Glenfarclas' warehouse.
This 40 year old Glenfarclas has the generous sherried notes the distillery is famous for.  It comes in an eye-catching box reminiscent of the iconic doors of Glenfarclas' warehouse.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 25 Year Old - 1978 Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION:
A single cask Port Ellen distilled in September 1978.
It was then bottled 25 years later in the same month of 2003.
Only one of 396 bottles drawn from cask #5258. It has been finished for 6 months in sherry wood.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Bicentenary Repatriation Japanese Edition 1977
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park Bicentenary release certainly has a great story behind it.
In 1997 it was thought to be sold out but in a warehouse, in Japan, hundreds of the bottles were discovered. 
This was re-released in 2008 and this is one of 690 bottles.

Macallan Oscuro, which is now discontinued is just a sherry lovers dream. It contains whiskies from 1987 to 1997. It was released at the high end of the 1824 series. Other bottles include the Gold, Amber, Sienna and Ruby.

This single malt from the now-closed distillery, Port Ellen, was distilled in 1982 and bottled in 2006 by Gordon and MacPhail.
It is part of their Connoisseurs Choice range and one of the most sought after independent bottlers in the world today.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 25 Year Old (1991) - Yellow Submarine WDMIII - The Legend Resurfaces
DESCRIPTION:
The Bruichladdich 25 Year Old Yellow Submarine, WMD III (Whisky of Mass Destruction III) The Legend Resurfaces is a 25 year old, single malt that has been matured in Refill Sherry & Bourbon, Spanish red wine casks.
This is the third release in the series that was created as a tribute to the early days at Bruichladdich; while searching through eBay back in 2016 Bruichladdich discovered a yellow submarine for sale that was identical to the bright yellow Royal Navy Submersible that Islay fisherman John Baker landed back in 2005 - Bruichladdich had to have it. 
To celebrate this find, Head Distiller Adam Hannett hunted out the of the original 1991 spirit which is now an incredible 25 years old and presented it as "WMD III The Legend Resurfaces".  This is one of only 1,991 individual numbered bottles available.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

This was Lagavulin’s release for the 2012 Feis Ile, distilled on the 23rd February 1998 matured in Cask #1716.  It was Selected by Iain McArthur and was bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.1%.
 
This is bottle numer 28.

Bottled at cask strength, this third party bottling of the 21 year old Macallan came from cask No16457.
Bottled in 2001, James MacArthur bottlings are becoming harder and harder to find.

A limited release from the home of Islay Jazz, Lagavulin. 2004 bottles were released and they were only available to purchase from the distillery.
Bottled at cask strength it displays a great balance between the classic Lagavulin smokiness and a refined tropical fruit flavour.

A limited release from the home of Islay Jazz, Lagavulin. 2004 bottles were released and they were only available to purchase from the distillery.

This bottling from the Islay giant is at 61.18% and of course a very limited bottling. 
This is bottle number 12715
This limited-edition 33 year old bottle was distilled at BenRiach Distillery in 1972. It was matured in an oloroso sherry butt cask and bottled in June 2006 at the natural cask strength of 45%.

A limited release from the home of Islay Jazz, Lagavulin. 2004 bottles were released and they were only available to purchase from the distillery.
Bottled at cask strength it displays a great balance between the classic Lagavulin smokiness and a refined tropical fruit flavour.

This is bottle number 1404.

This is bottle number 0064.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
A 16 year old lowland distilled in October 82 and bottled in Sept 99 a rarely seen bottle at auction.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Ellen - 21 Year Old - 1978 Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION:
A superb Port Ellen, from independent bottler Douglas Laing, distilled in December 1978. It was released as part of their Old Malt Cask range.
Bottled at 21 years old, in October 2000, this single cask yielded 342 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

The Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2015 release was a 24 year old, triple matured malt - aged in bourbon casks, px sherry casks and old oak puncheons. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.9%.  This was a limited release of 3500 individually bottles.

Single Cask of Daftmill bottled exclusively for Royal Mile Whiskies. This single cask whisky comes from cask #44, a first-fill American Oak bourbon hogshead from Heaven Hill distillery, which was filled with Daftmill spirit on July 31st 2006 and bottled in May this year at a cask strength of 56% ABV.
The cask yielded just 231 bottles. This expression has been bottled for Royal Mile Whiskies. Daftmill is a farm distillery. Owned and operated by the Cuthbert family, it only runs in the farm's quiet periods; midsummer and winter, sometimes producing as few as 100 casks per year.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing the malting barley used to make this lowland whisky. This single cask is a perfect representation of the Daftmill style and was voted for democratically by the Royal Mile Whiskies tasting team. Such a thorough investigation of the warehouses was only made possible with Mr Cuthbert's generosity and patience, as well as Mrs Cuthbert's delicious baking. 
Bottle number 201 of 231.

The Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2015 release was a 24 year old, triple matured malt - aged in bourbon casks, px sherry casks and old oak puncheons. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.9%.  This was a limited release of 3500 individually bottles.

This is a very elegant and clever presentation of Johnnie Walker.  This blended malt is made with three single malts married in European oak casks. The crystal decanter moves along with the motion of the ocean and its 'swing' design means it doesn't fall over.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 8 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION:
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the Night’s Watch guard. 
This lot contains 8 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

This beautifully presented bottling comes from an era before the distillery was mothballed in 1983. The whisky world are certainly glad to see it back and thriving. This is one of their oldest whiskies on the market at the moment.

The 1861 Replica is part of a series of replicas from Macallan which was released before the 1874 reproductions.
These antique pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 21 Year Old - Rare Malts 1975
DESCRIPTION:
Caol Ila 1975 21 Year Old Rare Malt bottling.
This rare single malt is part of a series done by Diageo of both operational and closed distilleries. 
This edition was distilled in 1975 and bottled at a very high strength of 61.3%
The bottle number is 5805.

Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distillery's 200th anniversary. In a beautiful presentation box, this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

SMWS 26.89 Clynelish 1984 27 Year Old
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
"An Exotic Tearoom Experience" from SMWS is a ex-sherry refill butt, that has been matured for 27 years. 
Distilled in November 1984 this is one of 485 bottles from the Highland distillery.

This is a very elegant and clever presentation of Johnnie Walker.  This blended malt is made with three single malts married in European oak casks. The crystal decanter moves along with the motion of the ocean and its 'swing' design means it doesn't fall over.

Now discontinued, this Japanese 15 year old is becoming sought after by collectors. Distilled at Yoichi, the first distillery founded by Nikka founder Masataka Taketsuru in 1934, this Japanese single malt was at 45% ABV.
This lot includes 4 x 70cl, from The Macallan Quest Collection, originally released for Travel Retail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Mhor 1976 Rare Malt 28 Year Old / 51.9%
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
Distilled in 1976 and subsequently bottled in April 2005, this Glen Mhor is 28 years old.
This is bottle number 2702.

This Jameson was blended using some of the oldest and rarest whiskeys from Jameson's maturing stock.  Some of which this is pot-still whiskey matured in a port pipe.
This bottling is discontinued and is popular with collectors, often considered a contender for the greatest Irish Whisky ever bottled.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
This is bottle number 98.
This 21-year-old Longrow, is a limited edition from Springbank Distillery in Campbeltown. This is one of only 3,600 bottles produced after maturation in sherry and bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 1983 Cellar Collection French Oak Finish
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1983 and bottled in 2003. This special dram was finished in French oak. 
It remains one of the youngest of the series and Jim Murray said 'sophistication and attitude rolled into one'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 24 Year Old - 1972 Rare Malt
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
This limited edition Royal Lochnagar is 24 years old.
Bottle number 48.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Millburn - The Whisky Shop 25 Year Old 1976
DESCRIPTION:
A Millburn distilled in August 1976 and bottled in May 2002.
It was matured in a single cask, obviously before the distillery closed in 1985. This was a special bottling by the whisky shop and is one of 276 bottles.

A Distillery Exclusive from Glendronach has been hand filled straight from the cask, at cask strength of 59% ABV.
It was distilled on 5th June 1992, aged in a sherry butt number 218 and bottled on 26th June 2019.
This is bottle number 515.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
This is bottle number 483.

DESCRIPTION: This bottle has been exclusively selected, produced & bottled in Scotland at Port Ellen distillery, Islay. The maturation process lasted 13 years before being bottled into this aesthetically pleasing decanter by Signatory Vintage.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.

Ardbeg Twenty One came from a Bourbon cask and matured for 21 years. In 2016 the fan club got the opportunity to purchase this committee release. They most certainly won't be disappointed if they grabbed that opportunity with both hands!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 21 Year Old -  Single Cask - Open Day 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This Springbank 21-Year-Old single cask was exclusively available at Springbank Distillery Open Day in May 2017. This is one of just 252 bottles produced. Distilled in December 1995. matured in a first fill port hogshead, and was bottled 2017 at 46%.
Situated right in the centre of Cambletown the distillery is hugely accessible to tourist and whisky lovers. Although, if this bottle is on the shelf you can be assured it will be snapped up.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
This is bottle 495.

Bottled at 100 proof, The Macallan Boutique Collection 2016 bottling was drawn from a selection of matured casks reserved only for distinguished guests visiting Easter Elchers House.
Released exclusively to Travel Retail - this is the first of a two batch release.

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
Distilled in 1973 at Dailuaine and bottled at 22 years old.
Bottled number 11192

This was a very limited release, in late 2018, to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the first Hibiki which was released in 1989.
Hibiki Japanese Harmony is a blend of over ten malts and grains featuring Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita all aged in five types of cask.  It was developed by fourth generation chief blender Shinji Fukuyo with production overseen by third generation master blender and great-grandson of the founder, Shingo Torii.
This limited edition has bottle art inspired by a traditional kimono pattern, embellished with tabane noshi – tied bundles of strips that have long been a symbol of cherished gifts.  As always with Hibiki the bottle always has 24 facets representing the 24 seasons of the Japanese lunar calendar.

Distilled and bottled from barley grown on the Kintyre Peninsula within just a few miles of Springbank distillery itself.
This barely is still malted on their own malt floors using traditional techniques. Bottling takes place on-site making it 100% Campbellton single malt.
Distilled: Sept 1999.
Bottled: October 2016.
9000 Bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 21 Year Old -  Single Cask - Societe Dugas
DESCRIPTION: This Springbank 21-Year-Old single bottling is one of just 336 bottles exclusively available for Societe Dugas. Matured in an oloroso sherry hogshead.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv.
A collectable bottling of 15-year-old Springbank single malt.  It features green thistle trapping on the label.
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - Alligator Committee Reserve For Discussion
DESCRIPTION:
The Ardbeg Committee release in June 2011 which was bottled 'for discussion'.
The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name.

Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.
 This is a 1-litre bottling.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

This Ardbeg Rollercoaster was released exclusively to the Ardbeg Committee in June 2010 to mark the 10th anniversary of The Ardbeg Committee.  The Rollercoaster consists of ten vintages from 1997 to 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Inverleven - 37 Year Old - 1973 Deoch an Doras
DESCRIPTION:
This is part of Chivas Brothers's Deoch an Doras series, roughly translated as 'One for the road', and was bottled in 2011 at 37 years old.
Distilled in 1973, this is a vintage whisky from Inverleven, a malt distillery that operated from within the Dumbarton grain distillery complex until 1991 when their malt production ceased. Inverleven is now a closed distillery.

An exclusive where the bottle could only be purchased from Dalmore distillery.
Cask 446 was chosen by distillery manager Ian Mackay.

Distilled at Littlemill, Dunglass is the peated version from 1967. Unfortunately, Littlemill has since been mothballed.
Made for the Italian market where younger whiskies are very popular.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Mhor - 22 Year Old 61% 1979 Rare Malt
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
Distilled in 1979 this Glen Mhor is 22 years old. Bottled a 61%.

This Glen Deveron 28 year old was matured in sherry oak casks to produce a fruitier malt with a smooth and mellow finish.  It was bottled from a collection of rare & aged Macduff malts, selected from the Private Reserve of Glen Deveron.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #004
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 004, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 58.3% in January 2012.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 12 Year Old - A'Bunadh - Sterling Silver Label - Millennium
DESCRIPTION:
Release for the Millenium, this is a rare bottle of Aberlour A'bunadh Silver Label Millenium limited-edition single malt whisky. This was aged in sherry butts for 12 years and bottled at cask strength. The label is made of 0.925 Sterling Silver.

This is bottle number 527.

Glenfiddich have really been pushing the boundaries of late with this  Experimental Series. Here we have all 4 bottles with a decorative plinth holding two branded glasses and hip flask.
A set of Glenfiddich Experimental Series numbers 1 through 4:
#1 IPA#2 Project XX#3 Winter Storm Batch III#4 Fire and Cain
A single barrel bottling of 16-year-old Macallan single malt. This is one of only 335 bottles filled by Douglas Laing, from a first fill bourbon cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 15 Year Old french Cognac Christmas 2015
DESCRIPTION:
For the Shareholders, Directors and staff, comes this private bottling of J & A Mitchell & Co Ltd.
It was for a Christmas present in 2015 and only 78 were ever produced.
This very rare 14 year old boxed bottling of Craigellachie, which is part of the Flora & Fauna series, but has since been discontinued.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Madrid & Barcelona
DESCRIPTION:
A twin pack of Johnnie Walker Blue label including Barcelona and Madrid Limited Editions.
Both designs feature unique detailing on the box of the cities.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
Distilled in May 89 and bottled on June 1st, this 12 year old expression is rather rare and very rarely seen at auction.
"Pink Marshmallow"

An older edition of Balvenie's classic single barrel series, a 15-year-old single malt, drawn from a single traditional oak whisky cask and bottled by hand.
Distilled on 22nd of January 1977 and bottled from cask #287 on the 23rd June 1993, this is bottle number 147. Although labelled a 15-year-old, this was actually bottled at 16 Year Old.

A Distillery Exclusive from Glendronach has been hand filled straight from the cask, at cask strength of 54.7% ABV.
It was distilled on 11th February 1994, aged in a sherry puncheon number 5086 and bottled on 11th July 2019.

The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
Bottled in 2000, this 18-year-olds life began in Jan of 82. A healthy cask strength dram at 59%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island it makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/99
This is bottle number 406.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island it makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/99
This is bottle number 408.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 1999 Single Cask - Feis Ile 2010
DESCRIPTION:
This 'Special Festival Edition' was distilled at Caol Ila on the 19th August 1999.  It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 61.9% for the 2010 Feis Ile.
Drawn from European oak ex-sherry cask number 305646.
This is bottle number 058.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

The Macallan Boutique Collection 2017 release was drawn from a selection of matured casks reserved only for distinguished guests visiting Easter Elchers House.
Released exclusively to Travel Retail - this is the second of a two batch release.

This is the second release from the Macallan Edition series.  Edition No.2 is a collaboration between Macallan's master blender Bob Delgarno and legendary Spanish chefs Joan, Josep and Jordi Roca.  The Rocas are the three brothers behind El Celler de Can Roca (named Best Restaurant in the World twice by Restaurant magazine).  This single malt was drawn from a combination of sherry puncheons, butts and refill hogsheads.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 19 Year Old - Hand Filled - Cask #2116
DESCRIPTION:
A hand-filled Bowmore distilled 21st June 1999, matured in sherry cask #2116 bottled on 18 July 2018.
 
This is bottle number 128.
A limited-edition of just 264 bottles released as part of Springbank Distilly's 2015 Open Day.  This whisky was aged in a refill claret cask,  bottled at 46% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This bottle number 485.

This limited edition 2016 Committee Release of Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’
Punchier than the standard release, this has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

A sought after Manager's Dram bottling. This single cask, chosen by the distillery manager was aged for 17 years in a sherry cask before being released in November 1992, at the cask strength of 62%.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hazelburn - 8 Year Old - First Edition Set
DESCRIPTION:
This lot has 3 x 70cl bottles of Hazelburn which is a triple distilled, completley unpeated single malt produced at Campeltown's Springbank Distillery. To celebrate the First Release Hazelburn, Springbank Distillers Ltd commissioned artist Ian Gray to paint 3 pictures of the distillery. These 3 paintings were then turned into both labels and a series of limited edition prints. 
There are 1700 bottles with each label released.

Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
