This is bottle number 189.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This is bottle number 449.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 1996 Single Cask - Feis Ile 2009
DESCRIPTION:
This 'Special Festival Edition' 12-year-old single cask malt was distilled at Caol Ila on the 18th December 1996.  It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58% for the 2009 Feis Ile.
Drawn from European oak ex-sherry cask number 19313, this is one of just 654 bottles. 
This is bottle number 597.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 15 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
Blair Athol 15 Year Old Manager's Dram from 1996. Bottled as part of the series of what is now known as Diageo.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. 
This expression was bottled in 1996 by distillery manager Gordon Donoghue.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This is bottle 484.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony Master's Select Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The new kid on the block for Hibiki, blending ten plus single malts and grains. These include Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita.
5 types of casks were used and typical Hibiki fashion the bottle always has 24 facets which represent 24 seasons in the Japanese lunar calendar.
Shinji Fukuyo, the fourth-gen blender has his name to this bottle. However, it wasn't without careful guidance from the third generation master blender.

This Strathisla 25 year old is relativly rare with only 600 bottles being produced.
It celebrates the restoration of the Distillery and it is stamped on the box with - Tuesday 9th May 1995.
For is age and the material of this box, it is in very good condition.

Aged in a single Oloroso sherry butt for 24 years, this rare 1992 vintage bottling of Glendronach is a UK exclusive boasting a mixture of spicy notes and herbal character. Bottled in 2016, this is one of 444 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 104.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tamnavulin - Glenlivet - 1968 The Old Mill - Special Reserve
DESCRIPTION: An old official bottling of 1968 vintage Tamnavulin under 'The Old Mill' label. It was distilled just two years after the distillery was founded and was bottled August 1986.  It is a limited edition of 1506 bottles.

One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.
Bottle number 949

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Cask Collection - Dusk, Dawn & Darkest (3 x 20cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This set includes 3 x 20cl Bowmore Cask Collection bottlings.  It is an excellent opportunity to sample three award-winning, discontinued single malt whiskies. 
Bowmore - Dusk - Bordeaux casked: 50%, 20cl Bowmore - Darkest: 43%, 20cl Bowmore - Dawn - Port casked: 51.5%, 20cl

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
Bottle number 537

At 44 years of age it is fair to say that this Invergordon is incredible, for a few different reasons. 
It comes as part of the private stock series after being distilled in March of 74 and being bottled in 2018. This refill barrel produced just 120 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 15 Year Old - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
Blair Athol 15 Year Old Manager's Dram from 1996. Bottled as part of the series of what is now known as Diageo.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. 
This expression was bottled in 1996 by distillery manager Gordon Donoghue.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 22 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old single malt was released by Caol Ila Distillery as their Fèis Ìle 2019 bottling.  It has been fully matured in Sherry-treated American oak hogsheads and bottled at a cask strength of 58.4% abv. The whisky is said to contain ‘fresh mint, citrus, spicy medicinal notes finished with a dominant note of spice’ on the palate.
This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 9.

This is a 30 year old bottling of Glenlivet which was distilled in October 1977 and bottled by an independent bottler in August 2008. The independent bottler was Douglas Laing and co but this was part of Glenkeir Treasurers Cask Strength Selection.
This bottle was a single cask and is one of 162 bottles.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This is bottle number 170.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019
This is bottle number 186.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 22 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old single malt was released by Caol Ila Distillery as their Fèis Ìle 2019 bottling.  It has been fully matured in Sherry-treated American oak hogsheads and bottled at a cask strength of 58.4% abv. The whisky is said to contain ‘fresh mint, citrus, spicy medicinal notes finished with a dominant note of spice’ on the palate.
This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 2011.
Ardbeg Supernova has been a super popular - the Committee Release sold out in just a few hours ack in January 2009. This was the peatiest Ardbeg ever at over 100ppm.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 18 Year Old - Moscatel Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This rare limited edition Bunnahabhain, one of only 250 bottles, has been exclusively created by the Master Distiller, Ian MacMillan for Fèis Ìle 2015.
Originally filled to traditional oak casks this exclusive expression has slowly matured in the warehouse at Bunnahabhain, where, after 16 years it was filled into carefully selected Moscatel wine hogsheads casks and returned to Warehouse No8. For a further 2 years the casks lay undisturbed, protected from the wrath of Atlantic storms and the long summer days. After 18 years this stunning expression has finally completed its journey and was decanted into only 250 bottles.  
This is bottle number 008 of 250.

This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
Glendullan's 23 year is one of the more rare releases in this series and was distilled in 1972.
Bottled at 62.43% and 75cl.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 23 Year Old - Black Art 1990 - Edition 4.1
DESCRIPTION: This fourth incarnation of the now legendary Black Art is as enigmatic as ever, the composition of casks a mystery to all but its creator. Working with the very finest American and French oak to explore that most esoteric relationship between spirit and wood, Black Art 4 is Master Distiller Jim McEwan’s personal voyage into the heart of Bruichladdich.

1883 production started creating mostly lightly peated malts. 
Twenty five years have been sent maturing in order to create different layers within this single malt.
The Margadale spring is said to create Bunnahabhains unique character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old Cask Strength Batch #001
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in February 2009, popular but a discontinued Laphroaig.
This was replaced by the non-age statement Laphroaig cask strength.
Lagavulin is the most wanted edition in the Distiller’s Edition range. Distilled in 1991, matured in Pedro Ximanez cask wood and bottled in 2007 at 43% ABV.

Distilled in 1976 and bottled in 1997 this 20-year-old Tomatin was matured in an Oak Cask.
Cadenhead is Scotlands older independent bottler and this bottling is part of their original collection.
Bottled free from colouring.

The Ardbeg Dark Cove was matured in ex-bourbon and dark Sherry casks to create ‘The Darkest Ardbeg Ever.’   This release, although bottled at a lower ABV than the Committee Release, has garnered great reviews, including one from Dramming.com's Oliver Klimek. It has notes of dark fruits, intense peat, ginger and bacon, with a long smoky finish.  It is said to be created to honour the Islay coastline's shadowy past – although the colour isn’t too dark at all, the dark casks used provide plenty of oaky depth.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned. The Supernova continues to evolve and has now brought a new dimension through deeper richness, more spiciness and a boost to the sweetness.

Distilled in 2001, this Springbank was aged for 15 years in a Guadeloupe rum cask, creating a complex dram.
In 2017 it was bottled at 50% ABV in May 2017. Only 218 bottles were produced.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

This is the third release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series. 
Created to show the complexity and depth that can be achieved through aging, Rare Cask comes from a broad selection of casks, including American oak sherry casks and European oak casks – a large number of which are first-fill.
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.
The Linkwood Manager's dram was chosen in 1999 on the 1st of December. This 12 year old was matured in a refill sherry cask chosen by Harry Fox, the distillery manager at the time.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 12 Year Old - Cote de Beaune
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of 12 year old Glenmorangie was matured for for 10 years in American Oak Barrels before being finished for 2 years in oak casks previously filled with Premier CRU Burgundy before being bottled at traditional strength.

A 19 year old refill cask Mortlach, specially selected by Malt Distillery Managers within Diageo Distilling Ltd. and bottled at cask strength of 55.8% in December 2002.  
This bottle is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of Diageo.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

This single malt was released by Glenmorangie in 2013 as part of their prestigious  Private Edition range - this was the 4th release in the series. 
Bottled in 2012 and distilled in 1993 the Ealanta was matured fully in virgin American white oak casks. These casks were special due to their heavily charred oak which came from a forest in Missouri. This is how it largely differs from its predecessors as it has been full-term matured opposed to just finished in 'designer' casks.
Awards include:

Dallas Dhu closed in 1983, one of many distilleries who closed that year and has now reopened as a museum.
This particular single malt was distilled in 1971.  It was bottled in 1994 at 40% abv by Gordon and MacPhail for their Connoisseurs Choice range.

One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.
Bottle 934/1000.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 11 Year Old - Friends of Laphroaig 10th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: A special bottling of Laphroaig at the unusual age of eleven years old - this was selected by Robert Hicks and Robin Shields to celebrate the tenth anniversary of the Friends of Laphroaig in 2004.
This was a very limited release by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2004 - it is one of 310 bottles.  This is a cask-strength, peated expression - 'Moine' is the Scottish Gaelic word for 'peat'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 16 Years Old (1993) - Single Cask No.523
DESCRIPTION: This 16 year old GlenDronach is part of The GlenDronach single cask bottlings series.  It is one of the first single cask batch released after the distillery was taken over by Benriach in 2008.  This is from the 1993 vintage and was bottled in July 1990 after being matured in Oloroso Butt number 523 for 16 years.  This is one of just 634 individually numbered bottles.

This is the third release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series. 
Created to show the complexity and depth that can be achieved through aging, Rare Cask comes from a broad selection of casks, including American oak sherry casks and European oak casks – a large number of which are first-fill.
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 21 Year Old XOP 1996 Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION:
Matured for 21 years in a refill hogshead, this Douglas Laing Highland Park bottling was distilled in September 1976.  Only 283 bottles were produced from this cask - DL12204. This is an individually numbered bottle.
 
This is bottle number 050.

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Port Ellen Special Blend
DESCRIPTION:
This limited release of Johnnie Walker's most premium brand which focuses on both lost and active distilleries.
Given that Brora shut its doors in 1983, we're talking about whisky that was distilled at least 35 years ago!
“Whiskies from these ghost distilleries are becoming increasingly rare. From our library of irreplaceable casks that we keep exclusively for Johnnie Walker Blue Label, I've chosen a few uniquely full-bodied expressions of these precious malts and grains to let people explore, in a new way, the extraordinary richness found in our pinnacle whisky.” Jim Beveridge

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

10 Year Old Glenfarclas 105...very, very popular among the masses especially at cask strength. 
Can you imagine how this 20 Year Old was first received when it was first released after spending a further 10 years in the cask and is still bottled at 60%!!
Brilliant!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Grant - 34 Year Old Duncan Taylor Rare Auld
DESCRIPTION:
With Duncan Taylor's head quarters just around the corner from The Grand Whisky Auction, it is very close to Speyside. They are originally from Glasgow and have one of the largest private collections of Scotch whisky in the world.
This Glen Grant is of a great age, 34 years to be precise, in cask 16577 and is one of 220 bottles.
This is bottle Number 9.

The Dalmore Dee Dram is part of the famous Dalmore 2011 River’s Collection. 
The Rivers Collection included four bottlings, each named after a famous Scottish Salmon river; The Dee, The Spey, The Tweed and The Tay.
The Dee Dram was released to help raise money for the River Dee Trust - a conservation trust which improves the habitat along the tributaries helps ease obstructions to fish migration and plants native trees along the riverbanks and upper sections of the Dee to protect rare and threatened Spring Salmon.

This single cask was distilled at the Braes of Glenlivet Distillery in the District of Speyside (Livet) on 19th October 1977, and was bottled from cask number 100762 in February 2000. 
It was bottled from a madeira wood cask when at strength 46% by Iain Mackillop and co Ltd.
This is bottle number 177.

The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Midleton - Very Rare - 2018 Vintage Release - Irish Whiskey
DESCRIPTION: A blend of famous whiskies released every year since 1984. Each bottle is signed by the master distiller Brian Nation. This is the 2018 bottling from the Midleton Very Rare collection which is the 35th edition.

This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

To commemorate the 2005 British Open Golf Championship at St Andrews, this bottle was commissioned by Luvian's bottle shop. This Springbank 12 Year Old comes in a lovely presentation box.
Cask number 589 yielded 278 bottles @ 70cl and @ 57.9%. 
This is bottle number 161.

This is the second release from The Macallan Rare Cask batched series.  It contains whisky drawn from just 50 sherry butts to craft a rich and fruity dram. 
This was one of 3 small-batch releases in the series realeased by Macallan in 2018.

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.

“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

Lagavulin is the most wanted edition in the Distiller’s Edition range. Distilled in 1991, matured in Pedro Ximanez cask wood and bottled in 1991 at 43% ABV.

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

This bottling of Benromach was distilled in 1982 and bottled directly from the Oak casks in June 1996 at cask strength 63% by Gordon & MacPhail.
Cask numbers are 1335 and 1341.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

A limited and somewhat rare bottling of Glenfiddich. Bottled on Christmas Day 1986 this expression celebrates 100 years of the distillery.
Every bottle comes with a certificate of authenticity and there was 12000 bottles released.

This 8 year old bottle of Bowmore was bottled for Feis ile which is Islay whisky festival. Distilled on the 14th June 1999 and was matured in Limousin Oak in warehouse 5.
Only 800 bottles were released. The bottle comes in velvet sack.
This is bottle number 50.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 11 Year Old - Friends of Laphroaig 10th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION: A special bottling of Laphroaig at the unusual age of eleven years old - this was selected by Robert Hicks and Robin Shields to celebrate the tenth anniversary of the Friends of Laphroaig in 2004.

SMWS 46.81 Glenlossie 12 Year Old 1988
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
From the banks of the river Spey come this Glenlossie 12 year old that was distilled in May 1988 and bottled in October 2000.
Matured in sherry casks in the heart of Islay at the Bowmore distillery. Darkest was popular among loyal Bowmore fans even though it is a non-age-statement.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
SMWS code 27.81 a 9 Year old Springbank - Rock salt and redcurrant.

SMWS 48.5 Balmenach 14 Year Old
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This 14 year old Balmenach was distilled in 1982 and matured on the banks of the Spey before being bottled in 1997.
Year of distillation: 1982Bottling period: 1997

After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
A vintage whisky from the same year the company was formed, this 13 year old Jura was bottled in 1996.
Island Hopping...

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This 1988 vintage was eventually bottled from the Bladnoch distillery in 2000. Only 294 bottles were yielded and bottled at cask strength.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside 12 year old from Strahila was bottled in 2002 after being distilled way back in 2002.
A melange of fresh fruit...

Available exclusively from the distillery on 26th May 2018, during Feis Ile. Matured for 18 Years, it was then bottled at 53.9% from a combination of refill American oak hogsheads, American oak hogsheads and ex-Bodega European oak butts.
This is bottle number 0061.

Caol Ila 2000 Single Cask Feis Ile 2011
Released for the annual festival on Islay, Feis Ile, in 2011, this Caol Ila was selected by Billy Stitchel.
Distilled on the 8th February 2000 this beauty was matured in Bodega Sherry cask #301696.

Ardbeg Galileo was one of 2012's most eagerly awaited releases.  It is made up from casks distilled in 1999, some of which spent their full term of maturation in casks that previously held Marsala wine.  This gives sweet tropical fruit flavours to the malt.  Galileo's concept is in celebration of the well-publicised experiment whereby small quantities of Ardbeg were sent into space at the end of 2011 to see how they mature in zero gravity.

This was a limited release of 11,550 bottles and is a peated malt which was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at the cask strength of 55.5%.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building CHchibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

Available exclusively from the distillery on 26th May 2018, during Feis Ile. Matured for 18 Years, it was then bottled at 53.9% from a combination of refill American oak hogsheads, American oak hogsheads and ex-Bodega European oak butts.

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Triple Cask 9 Year Old - Feis Ile 2009
DESCRIPTION:
One of 900 individually numbered bottles and bottled for the Feis Ile 2009.
This 9 year old Bowmore was distilled on the 14th of June 1999 and matured in warehouse No. 6.
A combination of casks was used - Sherry, Bourbon and Wine.
 
This is bottle number 116 of 900.
This is a cask strength Edradour, matured in single cask #235. Distilled in 1991.  This is one of only 633 decanters produced.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery has been matured for 17 years.  For the last 5 years, the whisky was finished in Sauternes hogsheads. This release is one of 3 by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2019.  It has been bottled at 54.2% ABV. This is one of only 1118 bottles produced.

Ardbeg Kildalton is a limited release that celebrates the ancient Celtic Kildaton Cross on Islay, which is 1200 years old.  This cross is only 5 miles away from the Ardbeg distillery and is steeped with history.
Kildaton was matured in ex-bourbon and ex-Sherry casks and bottled at 46% ABV with no chill-filtration.  This bottle was only sold at the distillery in 2014 and comes with a stunning lined presentation box.

This cheerful, limited Arran 1996 single malt has been aged for 12 years and was created from twenty casks.  A portrait of the eponymous peacock, who is a frequent guest at the distillery on the island features on the packaging.
The Peacock is the first in the series called 'Icons of Arran Distillery'. This is a limited edition of 6000 bottles.

Lagavulin 18 Year Old Cask Strength / Feis Ile 2018
26th May 2018, you were offered to buy this amazing expression from Lagavulin distillery when Feis Ile was in full swing. 18 Years for this spirit was enough for it to be bottled at 53.9% from a combination of refill American oak hogsheads, American oak hogsheads and ex-Bodega European oak butts.
Bottle number is 1939.

Available exclusively from the distillery on 26th May 2018, during Feis Ile. Matured for 18 Years, it was then bottled at 53.9% from a combination of refill American oak hogsheads, American oak hogsheads and ex-Bodega European oak butts.
This is bottle number 1391.

This 9 year old bottle of Bowmore was bottled for Feis ile which is Islay whisky festival. Distilled on the 14th June 1999 in sherry, bourbon and wine casks in warehouse 6.
There are 900 of these bottles released. The bottle comes in velvet sack.
This is bottle number 50.

This 2007 Fèis Ìle Bottling was distilled in February 2000.  It was matured in a fresh Sherry cask in Warehouse No.5 for 7 years. This is one of just 700 bottles released.
This is bottle number 622.
An older bottle of Laphroaig, bottled after the Royal Warrant was granted to Laphroaig in 1994.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old is smoother than the robust 10-year-old.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2013 and includes double matured Laphroaig from bourbon and port wood casks to create an exceptional balance of their signature peat flavour with tangy citrus fruits and a floral finish.
It was bottled at 51.3% ABV.
This is an old bottling of GlenDronach 12 Year Old Traditional single malt.  It was matured in seasoned oak and Sherry casks.  This is a bottle from the 1980s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - Single Cask 2004 9 Year Old Open Day 2013
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in February 2004 in Campbeltown, this bottling came from a refill Gaja Barolo hogshead. 
It was bottled in 2013 for the distillery's Open Day and is one of 295 bottles.

The Macallan 18 year old is a classic from the Speyside giant, first launched in 1984.
Distilled at the famous Easter Elchies Estate in Speyside this malt has been fully matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez in Spain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 15 Year Old - Flora & Fauna
DESCRIPTION:
One of the most sought after Flora and Fauna bottlings. This Caol Ila 15 year old has been discontinued for some time now and this is starting to show in the value of the bottle increasing over time.
Caol Ila is the only Islay bottling in the  Flora & Fauna collection which helps add to how rare it is.

1 of 395 bottles. 23 years old. Barbaresco Cask. 50.1%
The bottle depicts Sean Gordon, the warehouse relief shiftman.
Distilled in 1992. 
Bruichladdich 1992 Laddie Crew 09 James McColl Valinch
A distillery exclusive bottle, the 'Valinch' bottlings are only available for hand bottling at Bruichladdich distillery.  This Valinch was released in honour of the Warehouse relief shiftman Sean Gordon. 
Distilled in 1992 and matured in a barbaresco cask, bottled at 23 years old.

Distilled in 1980 this Dallas Dhu is a special Speyside single malt Scotch whisky, that was bottled in 2000 by Gordon & MacPhail.  Matured in a refill puncheon, this is a rare expression from a lost distillery.

Exclusively released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teaninich - 12 Year Old - Sherry Cask Adelphi 2007
DESCRIPTION:
A Teaninich single malt distilled in 2007 and matured in a single cask for 12 years before eventually being bottled in 2019 by Adelphi.
555 bottles were yielded from cask number 303666.

This bottling was in honour of Thomas Carlyle and is a combination of 10 sherry casks. It was distilled in 1990 and after maturation, it was bottled in 2017.
It is only one of 3000 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Braes of Glenlivet & Braeval - 1979 Signatory Vintage 19 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in April 99 after maturing in a sherry cask for 19 years.
Distilled: Novmeber 1979
Cask No: 9294
Bottle number 371 of 658.

Quite possibly one of the world's most recognisable Champagnes.
We will be drinking this Champagne well until the 2030s.

A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which was distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety used is 'Optic' that was grown in their south fields.

A rare Teaninich, released as part of the Manager's Dram series. The bottles were released exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength. 
This release was bottled in September 2001 at 58.3%.  It is a 17 year old single malt from refill casks.  
 
This is bottle number 974.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longrow - 15 Year Old Open Day 2014 1998 Single Cask 1
DESCRIPTION:
Springbanks heavily-peated expression was distilled in June 1998 and matured in a fresh Madeira hogshead. This expression was bottled for the open day in 2014 and if you havent been to one of these...it is a must!
Bottled:22nd May 2014
One of 186 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #005
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 005, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig. This release was bottled at 57.2% in February 2013.

From the Signatory Vintage collection comes this 1990 Signatory.
Matured in a Sherry butt for 24 years the cask yielded 530 bottles.
Bottled with natural colour - a real statement.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchroisk - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 16 year old single malt from the Auchroisk Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled in November 2015 at 55.6%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle 0881.

Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
A rebel in a bottle, this 10 year old is one of 250 bottles from Glenrothes.

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.
A special limited-edition decanter produced by Inver House to mark the centenary of the Speyburn distillery in 1997.  This is one of only 1,800 decanters produced.

An exclusive from Lagavulin comes the Offerman Edition which is a tribute to Nick Offerman. The gentleman was also known for his woodcraft skills and putting it to good use building his own boats. 
Lagavulin chose this dram for a reason, it comes from American white oak casks, a direct reflection of his passion.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore, Dusk - Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION: Created in the typical traditional fashion using fine ingredients, floor malting, wood fermenting, slow distillation and a patient maturing process. During the final maturation process, it matures in Bordeaux Wine Casks. The Bowmore reputation is renowned for not masking the unique taste providing a clear depth of colour and flavour to the bottle.

In 2018, Macallan released the first in their Concept series; a limited annual release celebrating bold visionaries who dare to think beyond traditional boundaries. This series joins the Rare Cask and Quest collections as a travel retail exclusive.
Number 1 is inspired by surrealist art - with the label depicting the Macallan Six Pillars in the style of surrealism - which is apparently echoed through the innovation of their slightly different maturation process in the production of this release.
Cask Type: Sherry Oak Casks followed by an equal time in Ex-Bourbon Casks

The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore distillery’s classic peat smoke. A Bowmore Legend (Limited Edition). Created in the Bowmore Distillery one of the oldest distilleries in Scotland. Part of a distinctive series of limited edition tins, the illustration shown on the tin depicts a legend of romance through the eyes of an artist.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt. The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

The Macallan Classic Cut - 2018 edition is the second release in the limited annual series.  It was matured exclusively in hand-picked oloroso sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain, before being bottled at 51.2% ABV.
It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours. 
 
The bottle is signed by a distiller at Macallan.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

Released for the 2010 Feis Ile and sold exclusively from Laphroaig Distillery.  Cairdeas, meaning Friendship, is an annual limited edition release from Laphroaig Distillery. This bottling is a harmony of malt ranging from 11 to 19 years of age. It was specifically selected by Laphroaig Master Blender Robert Hicks in celebration of the 2010 Feis Ile and Friends of Laphroaig worldwide.

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 14. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

One of only 250 bottles, this rare bottling of Balblair comes from cask number 12648, a refill sherry hogshead. 
Bottled in 2010 by Gordon & Macphail.
This is the 2nd release of the 1990 vintage by Balblair. It was distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2017 with its natural colour, at 46%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Linkwood - 25 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
A Speyside classic from Linkwood / Gordon Macphail. 
Bottled after 25 years of maturation, these labels are exclusive to G&M. This series is all about how the distillers only allowed official bottlings. However, this has now changed with time and what a great job G&M have made!

This bottle is an 18 year old Extremely Rare, Highland single malt produced by Glenmorangie. It has been perfected by the sixteen men of Tain who have specially aged this bottle for 18 years in superior oak casks and a period in Oloroso Sherry casks.
This bottle has an expression of great depths and richness which will come from the revealing flavours of vanilla, almonds and dried fruits.

A family owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

This limited edition is one of only 1760 bottles which has been distilled in 2008 and bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley. 
The barley variety is called Optic and was grown in the south fields.

The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 2004 Moine Port Pipe Finish - Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION:
This 2004 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain was limited to just 1596 bottles, released for the Feis Ile 2017.
Distilled in December 2004 it was matured in refill hogshead casks, then finished in Moine Port Pipes.  It was bottled in March 2017 at 55.6%. 
 
This is bottle number 1045.
A smart old bottle of Laphroaig, bottled in the mid to late 1990s, after the award of the Royal Warrant in 1994. Laphroaig 15 Year Old is smoother than the robust 10-year-old.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

Exclusively released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

This is a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old, released in 1994 to celebrate a Royal Warrant being granted to the distillery by His Royal Highness Prince Charles.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a limited edition of 2200 bottles, with a unique label and gift box.

Balvenie 21 Year Old Port Wood certainly holds its own in the core range. 
It lives up to its name having an additional period of maturation in 30 year-old port pipes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Old Style
DESCRIPTION:
An older, and now very rare, bottling of Johnie Walker Blue Label. 
With its distinctive square bottle, the label angled precisely at 24° and the iconic Striding Man, Johnnie Walker is the world's best selling Scotch whisky. It was created in Kilmarnock in 1865 and is now available in almost every country in the world. Between 1906 & 1909 John Walker's grandsons introduced the colour names which the bottles still bear to this day.

This Bunnahabhain started life in 2005 in whisky refill casks, before being transferred into Palo Cortado casks on 30/07/2015 to rest for a little longer in the coastal warehouses before being bottled as a distillery exclusive.
Palo Cortado is a rare type of sherry that started as a Fino or an Amontillado. During the ageing process, the flor becomes damaged or dies off, which leads to the sherry ageing oxidatively, giving it some of the sweeter characteristics more common in Oloroso sherry.
Only 624 bottles were available at the distillery and online shop.
Most certainly worth having in the collection1
This is bottle number 6.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Port Charlotte - The Heretic 2001: 'The Last of the First' - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Heretic, 2001 has been named 'The Last of the First' as the limited release of 1300 bottles was from the last five casks from Port Charlotte’s first year of distillation in 2001. Adam Hannett, Head Distiller carefully married these five casks which previously held either American whiskey, rum or fine French wine. 
This was a limited edition, Feis Ile 2018, Distillery exclusive release from Bruichladdich Distillery.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 12 Year Old - Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dallas Dhu - 12 Year Old Gordon and Macphail
DESCRIPTION: From the Speyside distillery, a 12 Year Old bottled by Gordon and Macphail.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Sherry Cask - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION: This is one of just 3000 bottles in this release by Bowmore which was sold exclusively at the distillery, during Fèis Ìle 2018.  This single malt has been matured exclusively in first-fill Oloroso sherry casks for 15 years.  It was bottled at the cask strength of 52.5% ABV.

This Bunnahabhain started life in 2005 in whisky refill casks, before being transferred into Palo Cortado casks on 30/07/2015 to rest for a little longer in the coastal warehouses before being bottled as a distillery exclusive.
Palo Cortado is a rare type of sherry that started as a Fino or an Amontillado. During the ageing process, the flor becomes damaged or dies off, which leads to the sherry ageing oxidatively, giving it some of the sweeter characteristics more common in Oloroso sherry.
Only 624 bottles were available at the distillery and online shop.
Most certainly worth having in the collection!
This is bottle number 23.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 8 Year Old The Machrihanish Golf Club 140th Anniversary​
DESCRIPTION:
A private bottling of an 8 year old Springbank.
It was matured in a sherry butt then bottled for the Machrihanish Golf Club to mark their 140th anniversary.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Aberlour - 15 Year old Blackadder Raw Cask
DESCRIPTION:
A Speyside Dram and one of 207 bottled at cask strength from a single Sherry Hogshead number 3325.
Bottled in 2005 it is all-natural colour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 12 Year Old -  Cairdeas - Feis Ile 2009
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

Released on 21st May 2015 for Springbank Open Day. This single malt was distilled at Springbank in November 2007 and matured for a full 7 years in a fresh Sauternes hogshead.
This is one of 309 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Sherry Cask - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION: This is one of just 3000 bottles in this release by Bowmore which was sold exclusively at the distillery, during Fèis Ìle 2018.  This single malt has been matured exclusively in first-fill Oloroso sherry casks for 15 years.  It was bottled at the cask strength of 52.5% ABV.

The Macallan recently launched the Aurora at the Taiwan duty free-exclusive event in Taiwan. They utilised panoramic projection technology to reveal the product.
This expression is only available at Taiwanese Travel Retailers.
Fully matured in 4 different handpicked European and American Oak casks.

This limited edition bourbon cask matured Bowmore was released for Feis Ile 2014. This is one of only 1000 bottles.
This is bottle number 199.

Bowmore - Virgin Oak - Fèis Ìle 2015 
A festival release from Fèis Ìle 2015 of 1,000 bottles matured in selected virgin oak casks and bottled at natural strength. 
This is bottle 311.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.
A 12 year old official bottling from this lost Lowand distillery Littlemill.  This is a rare bottling that is becoming increasingly hard to find.

The fourth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, this Speyside single malt is a celebration of the distillery's whisky making heritage, combining a unique selection of oak cask styles. Edition No.4 reflects the craftsmanship and pioneering design of the new Macallan distillery.

This was the Bowmore festival bottling for Fèis Ìle 2013. It was matured in bourbon cask strength and was bottled at 56.5% and non-chill-filtered. This is one of 1000 bottle.
This is bottle number 699.

This Diageo Special Teaninich 17-Year-Old was eagerly anticipated by many.  Distilled in 1999, it was released in 2017 to celebrate the distillery centenary.
The single malt was matured in refill American oak hogsheads and sherry butts,  resulting in delightful candied sweet spice notes.
This litre bottle of Glenmorangie was Matured for 10 years in mountain oak and bottled at 100 proof (57.2% abv). It is unchill filtered - straight from the wood in its original and most natural form.

This 12 year old from Knockando is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram Series. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo.  Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59%.

This bottling was produced from spirit originally distilled on the 24th June 1982 at the Imperial Distillery. This bottle is from an unbleneded cask of 24 year old malt whisky, cask #3969 and bottled by Direct Wines for the First Cask Range.  This is an individually numbered bottle.
This is bottle number 600.

Old Pulteney 17 Year Old got a very high score in the whisky bible - 96.5! All this in the same year as receiving an award for the best whisky in the world.
This specific bottling has since been discontinued... you know what that means.

Knochdhu distillery has produced fine malt whisky since 1894. With this limited edition of Cask Strength, 21 year old Knochdhu have created a single malt whisky of uncommon distinction.
This bottle is 56.5% ABV.

Bowmore 17 Year Old was once the centrepiece of the core range.
Often more famous for their upper-end bottlings this is not to be forgotten about. The number one vaults continue to produce some wonderful expressions.
This bottle has been signed by the distillery manager at the time.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Fine Oak (Signed Limited Edition)
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.
This bottle is a limited edition and the back of the bottle and the back of the box feature the signature of Bob Dalgarno, Macallan Master Blender.

Distilled in December 2007, this Bunnahabhain single malt was aged for 10 years -  fully matured in Oloroso sherry casks.
This was a limited release of just 1881 bottles.  This was one of two bottlings from Bunnahabhain released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018.
This is bottle number 14.

Distilled and bottled from barley grown on the Kintyre Peninsula within just a few miles of Springbank distillery itself.
This barely is still malted on their own malt floors using traditional techniques. Bottling takes place on-site making it 100% Campbellton single malt.
Distilled July 2009.
Bottled in October 2019.
9000 Bottles produced.
This was a very limited release by Bunnahabhain - it is one of 310 bottles.  This is a cask-strength, peated expression - 'Moine' is the Scottish Gaelic word for 'peat'.

A first edition cask strength bottling from Toashuzo Co.
Bottled from Cask 9585, this has the potential to be a great investment for the future.

This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old Islay, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength for the annual Islay whisky festival in May.
This is bottle number 29.

The Macallan recently launched the Aurora at the Taiwan duty free-exclusive event in Taiwan. They utilised panoramic projection technology to reveal the product.
This expression is only available at Taiwanese Travel Retailers.
Fully matured in 4 different handpicked European and American Oak casks.

This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old Islay, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength for the annual Islay whisky festival in May.
This is bottle number 1906.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - 2004 Hand Filled - Cask #1873
DESCRIPTION:
A hand-filled Bowmore distilled on the 14th May 2004, matured in bourbon cask #1873 & bottled on the 22 May 2018. It was available exclusively at Bowmore Distillery.
 
This is bottle number 34.

Springbank distillery is unique for a variety of reasons.
1. It's the oldest distillery in Scotland (family owned)
2. 100% of the production and processes are on one site.
3. The largest private employer in Campbeltown. 
This 9 year old dram came from a refill marsala hogshead. Distilled in September 2006 and bottled in May 2016. It is one of only 276 bottles.

Bottled by Cadenhead for Wilson and Morgan.
Distilled in 1980 and bottled in 1993 for the Barrel Selection.

Distilled and bottled from barley grown on the Kintyre Peninsula within just a few miles of Springbank distillery itself.
This barely is still malted on their own malt floors using traditional techniques. Bottling takes place on-site making it 100% Campbellton single malt.
Distilled July 2009.
Bottled in October 2019.
9000 Bottles produced.
This was Lagavulin’s 2017 Fèis Ìle bottling. It is a 16-year old, Moscatel Cask Wood double matured, limited to 6000 individually numbered bottles.  Bottled in 2017 at natural cask strength.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - Feis Ile 2016 - Virgin Oak & Oloroso Sherry
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle was released during Feis Ile 2016. 
It is made with a marriage of four American virgin oak barrels and a 1st fill Oloroso sherry butt. After being married together the spirit was returned to the original casks for a longer period of maturation.  Bottled at a cask strength of 54.9% and limited to only 1500 bottles. 
This is bottle number 106.

The first release of the Oban entry in Diageo's Distillers Edition range. It is a special limited edition release, distilled in 1980 and finished in Montilla casks to spice up the distillery's signature maritime character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Cask Strength 55.7% (5 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 5 x Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Cask Strength 5cl bottlings.
Blowing your socks off at a nice little cask strength of 55.7% this Islay malt is 10 years old.
Bottled straight from the wood the rich flavours come through like never before.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Longrow - 15 Year Old Campbeltown Malts Festival 2019 - Fresh Rum Casks 2004
DESCRIPTION:
Longrow official from the Springbank distillery a heavily peated single malt.
Distilled in February 2004 and released for the distillery's open day on the 23rd of May in 2019 for the Campbeltown Malts Festival.
One of 911 bottles, it has been matured 15 years in a fresh rum cask.
Originally a travel retail exclusive released in 2012, this special bottling celebrates the 125th anniversary of Glenfiddich's opening, with spirit running from the stills on Christmas day 1887.

Released in 2008, Ardbeg Blasda is a lesser-peated version of many people's favourite Islay malt, being just 8ppm in bottle (as opposed to the standard 10yo's 23ppm).  It is described as 'a lighter taste of Islay.' It has hints of sweets and chocolates for a pleasant accompaniment to the mild characteristic Ardbeg peaty tones. After all, 'Blasda' in Gaelic means 'sweet and delicious.'

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 10 Year Old (2006) - Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 10 year old Royal Lochnagar is from the highly collectable Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. The bottles were released to be available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. Each release was selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This single malt has been matured in European Oak casks. It was bottled and released in 2006, at the natural cask strength of 57.2%.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.
This is a 375ml bottle (equivalent to a half bottle of 75cl).

The final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection! The Six Kingdoms - a limited edition, 15-Year-Old Mortlach.  Matured in first-fill sherry casks and finished in American oak bourbon casks. It comes in a  presented in a metallic gold presentation tube, decorated with a pen and ink drawing of the mysterious three-eyed raven (aka Bran the Broken).

This is an old-style old presentation bottling of Glenlivet Archive. The age of the whiskies released under the Archive label has changed over the years. This bottle dates from when it didn't have an age statement. Supposedly only the best casks are selected for the archive and are only used for blending an expression when they are fully mature.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dufftown - 14 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
From The Manager's Dram range (a series of releases for Diageo staff members featuring whiskies picked out by distillery managers) comes a 14 year old single malt from Dufftown. The label features a golden salmon jumping over a picture of the distillery.
This is bottle 0799

Enigma is a 12 Year Old bottling released by Bowmore, originally bottled for Travel Retail. Enigma is an unusual expression for Bowmore as a greater amount of fresh sherry casks have been used over its 12 years of maturation.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 12 year old special bottling was created to celebrate the 2009 Feis Ile.

This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
This is one of 1710 bottles.
This is bottle number 0957.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - 2004 Hand Filled - Cask #1873
DESCRIPTION:
A hand-filled Bowmore distilled on the 14th May 2004, matured in bourbon cask #1873 & bottled on the 22 May 2018. It was available exclusively at Bowmore Distillery.
 
This is bottle number 30.

Distilled in 1985, this Glenturret single malt was matured in cask no 122 for 17 years.  It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.1%m by Wilson & Morgan as part of their barrel selection series.

This 15 Year Old Glenkinchie is part of the Manager’s Dram Series, which were available exclusively to employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were specially selected by distillery managers within Diageo and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is a numbered bottle.

DESCRIPTION: This cask strength Caol Ila, is a rare rebottling for the participates of the Johnnie Walker Mentoring that took place. This bottle has no age against it but we know it was bottled at cask strength of 55%.

DESCRIPTION:

Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Strathmill - 15 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:

The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.

It celebrates Macallan's ongoing commitment to seek out the extraordinary and create whiskies of unique character.  This single malt offers a whisky with dominant sweetness with balanced flavours.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 18 Year Old Ancient Reserve Decanter
DESCRIPTION: A classic decanter containing 18 year old Glenfiddich, produced by Spode.

This is a striking, non-age-statement bottling from Glenmorangie.  Some of the oldest malt used was over 30 years ago, making it a really rich dram.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #006
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 006, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 58.0% in February 2014.
All of the barley used to make this 9 year old has been sourced within the local area of  Kintyre, Scotland (as the name may suggest).  A much sought-after bottle by collectors and investors.

Glenmorangie Traditional is 100 Proof which equates to 57.2% BAV.
A limited edition, this expression was matured for 10 years in mountain oak until being bottled at its natural strength.
Before 1700 the farmers of Ross-shire originally supplied malt whisky to the royal burgh of Tain, the home of Glenmorangie.
Aromas: Cloves, cinnamon, vanilla. honey and citrus fruits.

The Caol Ila Fèis Ìle Festival 2013 release was bottled at cask strength and was distilled in 1998 Cask Strength. 3000 individually numbered bottles were released. It was selected by Billy Stitchell and he had this to say about the whisky:-
“Spirit distilled in 1998 has been triple-cask matured. For 12 years it rested in a combination of Refill Butts, Hogsheads and Barrels. The vatted whisky was then allowed to mature for several months in active hogshead casks to impart a spicy/oaky note to the existing delicate Caol Ila smoke. Finally, it was treated to a final gentle maturation in European oak.”
This is bottle number 2431.

This is a 2017 Fèis Ìle Festival bottling from Bowmore Distillery. It has been matured for 11 years in Oloroso sherry and Bordeaux wine casks. It was bottled at cask strength.  This is a limited release of only 2000 bottles.   
This is number 1526.
Originally a travel retail exclusive released in 2012, this special bottling celebrates the 125th anniversary of Glenfiddich's opening, with spirit running from the stills on Christmas day 1887.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2014 and includes double matured Laphroaig from bourbon barrels and Amontillado seasoned traditional hogsheads.  It was bottled at 51.4% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Imperial - 20 Year Old - Cask Strength - 1995 Signatory Vintage
DESCRIPTION:
This distillery has was mothballed and then was completely demolished just as it was becoming increasingly popular.
Bottled on the 31st August 2016 by Signatory to go in their Cask Strength Collection.
One of 521 bottles, this single malt was matured in hogsheads #50268 and #50269.

This is a 2017 Fèis Ìle Festival bottling from Bowmore Distillery. It has been matured for 11 years in Oloroso sherry and Bordeaux wine casks. It was bottled at cask strength.  This is a limited release of only 2000 bottles.   
This is bottle number 0113.

This is one of 2202 bottles.

This is one of only 1096 bottles.

This is one of only 4080, individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 529.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 15 Year Old - 2003 Amontillado Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 2019 distillery exclusive from Bunnahabhain Distillery. This Amontillado Cask Finish limited edition started life on the 20th of February 2003 in refill hogsheads before being transferred to Amontillado sherry hogsheads on the 26th of February 2016 where it spent two more years maturing in Bunnahabhain's coastal warehouses.
The result is 1710 bottles of rich, oaky single malt, with notes of dark chocolate and treacle toffee.

This is a 2017 Fèis Ìle Festival bottling from Bowmore Distillery. It has been matured for 11 years in Oloroso sherry and Bordeaux wine casks. It was bottled at cask strength.  This is a limited release of only 2000 bottles.

The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo. These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.
This is bottle number 0558.
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old is part of their core range and it packs a punch! You will go a long way to find a dram with more depth.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 12 Year Old - Flora and Fauna (Wooden Box)
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old from Blair Athol is one of the gems of the Flora & Fauna range. It is beautiful and sadly under acclaimed Highland single malt. This Blair Athol is a sherried style, with spices and oak adding complexity to rich maltiness.
Comes with wooden presentation box.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Distillery Excluisve - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of Bowmore's Fèis Ìle distillery exclusive releases of 2019.  It was created through a marriage of some of their finest bourbon casks.  The 15 year old single malt has notes of oak spice and bergamont balanced with the sweetness of candied orange shortbread.  This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 33.

Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 602, which was stored on rick number 56. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.

Distilled, 31st October 2004 and matured in a first-fill sherry American Oak Cask for 13 years.
This is one of 2202 bottles. 
A limited-edition and is spookily sought after....

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Loch Dhu  - 10 Year Old - The Black Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
This Black malt is of divided opinion in the whisky community. The origin of its dark nature is either one of a fairytale or simply caramel colouring.
Produced at Mannochmore there is no doubt, with this whisky becoming increasing hard to find, it is becoming very collectable.
Matured exclusively in oak sherry casks from Jerez in Spain.  This age statement was discontinued by Macallan in 2013.

The 3 Isles Classic Pillage is a vatting of bottles from Jura, Ardbeg and Tobermory
This challenge was completed on 8/9/10.
Bottle number 38 of 200.

This is bottle number 101.
This is a 70cl bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat.
