This is bottle number 65.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2012 bottling combines some of the original liquid used to create càideas, further matured and complemented with newer Laphroaig spirit that has been fully matured in quarter casks.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  Today, it is the biggest selling single malt from Islay, and one of the last distilleries using its own floor maltings.
A limited edition that was released during Laphroaig open day at the Feis Ile 2015, to celebrate 200 years of Laphroaig.
For this special edition, Cairdeas Master Distiller John Campbell used 100% floor malted barley (from the distillery’s own small malting floor) and used only the two smaller, older stills during distillation. It was also fully matured in Warehouse No.1, right by the sea on Islay.
Laphroaig truly wanted to ensure this was a special release for their 200th Anniversary and is John’s interpretation of how Laphroaig would have been produced 200 years ago.  It was matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  Today, it is the biggest selling single malt from Islay, and one of the last distilleries using its own floor maltings.
A limited edition that was released during Laphroaig open day at the Feis Ile 2015, to celebrate 200 years of Laphroaig.
For this special edition, Cairdeas Master Distiller John Campbell used 100% floor malted barley (from the distillery’s own small malting floor) and used only the two smaller, older stills during distillation. It was also fully matured in Warehouse No.1, right by the sea on Islay.
Laphroaig truly wanted to ensure this was a special release for their 200th Anniversary and is John’s interpretation of how Laphroaig would have been produced 200 years ago.  It was matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 10 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The 2018 Fèis Ìle release from east coast legends Caol Ila was a 10 year old expression was aged in a combination of rejuvenated European oak butts and refill American hogsheads.
This is bottle number 61.

This bottle was released by Caol Ila's to celebrate Fèis Ìle 2014. It is a 12 year old matured in refill American oak Hogsheads, personally selected by David Wood.  It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.5%.

Mull's Tobermory celebrated the distilleries bicentenary in 1998.
This bottling was released to commemorate the occasion. 
This bottle is one of only 2500 produced.
This bottle is number 370.

This limited edition, 2018 bottling was released to celebrate The  2018 Islay Jazz Festival.  The single malt was matured in hand selected first fill American Oak & refill Hogsheads and Puncheons before being bottled at a natural cask strength of 58.5%. Each bottle is individually numbered.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.
A 10 year old single malt from The Macallan Distillery.  It has been exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 13 Year Old - Moine Marsala - Handfill
DESCRIPTION: This single cask hand-filled bottling was sold exclusively the Distillery. Moine is the name given to heavily-peated Bunnahabhain.  It has been aged for 13 years, including a finishing period in Marsala. This bottle was hand-filled at the distillery on 24th October 2018, at the cask strength of 53% ABV.

Glen Ord distillery is just outside of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years. 
This now-discontinued bottling was matured in Sherry oak casks for 12 years.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

A very rare Glenfiddich which spent most of its time ageing in bourbon casks before being moved across for a sherry finish.
Although not stated on the bottle it is around 12 years old.

10 Year Old whiskies from Islay distilleries blended together and bottled in 2003.
This was in aid of Cancer Research and the Islay Life Boat.
Making this even more special each malt had been collected by a team member of the boat which rowed around Islay in the process.
42 miles were covered in the process.

Ardbeg Perpetuum release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

'Single malt from a single cellar.' 
The Cellar Master selected only 1st fill casks from Cellar 13 at Glenmorangie Distillery to create this edition.  The single malt was matured for 10 years in American mountain oak.

This limited Glenburgie release was bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company.  Glenburgie is one of the key components of Ballantine's blended whiskies. The bottle label illustration plays on the idea that Glenburgie is also the resting place of real-life actual giant's helmet.  Apparently, he left it thereafter stopping by for a couple of little wooden cups of delicious single malt whiskies (or 'casks' as the terrified distillery workers called them).  This bottle is part of Batch 1, and is one of 183 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 96.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Pillage Trilogy - 14 Year Old - Blended Malt 2007
DESCRIPTION:
Whisky was 'pillaged' from every Islay distilleries (not the closed ones) and Jura and finally Bushmills in Northern Ireland.
The last in the Trilogy series & bottled in March 2008. 
This charitable bottle has the participants row between each of the distilleries in order to collect the whisky.
All proceeds were donated from the sale of these bottles.
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas Ileach Edition Feis Ile 2011
DESCRIPTION:
In 2011 the Feis Ile festival releases this Cairdeas from Laphroig.
Master Distiller, John Campbell, created the 'Ileach Edition'. He is the first Islay native to be in this position at Laphroaig.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Black Friday - 21 Year Old - Whisky Exchange III 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The third release from The Whisky Exchange and their Black Friday bottling. It sold out in 11 minutes because it an outstanding dram. It was bottled at cask strength...
Last year’s release was a Highland Park (unofficial) and this year an older undisclosed Speyside 21 Year Old year old was chosen.
They did disclose that the distillery was founded as early as 1810, located between Forres and Elgin and rarely seen as a single malt whisky.
Glen Burgie?????
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2014 and includes double matured Laphroaig from bourbon barrels and Amontillado seasoned traditional hogsheads.  It was bottled at 51.4% ABV.
Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Grant's - 25 Year Old Royal Doulton Decanter 1980s
DESCRIPTION:
A man you probably would like to come across in a dark alley...especially when full of whisky!! Jokes aside, this decanter is a collaboration between Grant's and Royal Doulton.
The dram inside is 25 years old and it is actually a depiction of William Grant's. It is one of only 5000 produced.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks.

A limited-edition and the first release from Glenkinchie that has been finished in Amontillado casks.
Double matured and looked after by mater distiller B. Bisset.
Id: G/273-7-D

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited release 15-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 15-Year-Old for a limited edition release.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18 Year Old.

Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget). 
This is an older style presentation of the Laphroaig 18 Year Old in the green tube.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenallachie - Single Port Cask - 13 Year Old #866
DESCRIPTION:
This distillery has recently been bought over by Billy Walker, formally of Benriach and Glendronach. Ever since their quality has skyrocketed, with lots of single casks being produced and winning multiple awards. 
This particular release is a single cask port pipe which matured for 13 years. One of 890 bottles from cask number 866.
This bottling also celebrates 10th anniversary of whisky blog, Ralfy.com

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruicladdich - 13 Year Old - Valinch 45 - Christy McFarlane
DESCRIPTION:
Edition 45 in the Bruichladdich Valinch collection, that features the employees of Bruichladdich. This release features Christy McFarlane- Malts Communications Manager.
Distilled in June 2006 and aged for 13 years in a Premium Spanish Wine Cask #546.
This is one of only 533 bottles produced. 
This is bottle 264.

A great hand filled bottling from warehouse 9 at Bunnahabhain that has been matured in a Caorag cask. 
Bottled 18/06/19

This lot contains 2 x 35cl bottles from Tomatin Distillery - both 46% ABV.
It is the ideal opportunity to compare the effect of a bourbon and sherry cask on whisky distilled in specific years at the distillery. Graham Eunson the Distillery Manager created 2 incredible whisky's by having selected and vatted casks from the same 6 years (1973, 1977, 1988, 1991, 2002, 2006) in both types of casks.
This release was personally selected by The Distillery Team and bottled at the cask strength of 54.1%. Limited to only 7,500 bottles, they were exclusively available at Lagavulin Distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Pillage Trilogy 2005 - 12 Year Old - Blended Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Pillaged from each of the operating Islay distilleries and from Bushmills in Northern Ireland and just across the water on Jura.
The masters behind this bend rowed between each of the distilleries in order to collect the whisky which was eventually created for all proceeds to be donated to charitable causes.

This is a classic 10 year old created by The Balvenie Malt Master, David Stewart, from malt matured in bourbon cask and sherry butts.  It was a cornerstone of The Balvenie range since the early 1980s, but the Founder’s Reserve has now been discontinued.
In 2000, The Balvenie Founder's Reserve 10 year old won the International Wine & Spirit Competition Trophy for Best Single Malt under 12 years old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 12 Year Old - Feis Ile 2017
DESCRIPTION:
A 12 year old Caol Ila bottled for the 2017 Feis Ile.  This limited edition was double matured in Amoroso Cask Wood and was bottled at cask strength of 55.8%. This is one of 1,500 individually numbered bottles.
 
This is bottled number 0024.

Laphroaig 18 Year Old was introduced in 2009 as a replacement for the old 15 Year Old (Prince Charles' sorely missed favourite whisky, lest we forget). 
This is an older style presentation of the Laphroaig 18 Year Old in the green tube.

This Lagavulin Distillers Edition was distilled in 1999 before being bottled in 2015. This 16-year-old single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was matured for up to 6 months in European Pedro Ximenez Sherry oak casks - these give the whisky more fruity and syrupy character.
Batch lgv.4/504.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blair Athol - 18 Year Old - Bicentennial Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This lot is a 18 year old bottling is to celebrate 200 years of malt whisky distilling at Blair Athol Distillery. This special cask strength limited edition bottling has been produced as a tribute to the staff, past and present.
This is bottle number 261.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.
This bottle comes with its own black carry case.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Distillery Excluisve - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of Bowmore's Fèis Ìle distillery exclusive releases of 2019.  It was created through a marriage of some of their finest bourbon casks.  The 15 year old single malt has notes of oak spice and bergamont balanced with the sweetness of candied orange shortbread.  This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 84.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 12 Year Old - Feis Ile 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 year old Caol Ila was bottled for the 2016 Feis Ile. Matured in refill American oak hogsheads and European oak bodega ex-sherry butts. Each bottle is individually numbered and was bottled at cask strength.
This is bottle number 0789.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bailie Nicol Jarvie - Old Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION: This 'Very Old Reserve' blend is from Nicol Anderson & Co LTD, Queen's Dock, Leith. It is made up of malt sourced from the Highlands, Lowlands and Islands of Scotland with all whiskies used being over 8 years old.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

The Macallan Amber forms part of The Macallan 1824 Series which exemplifies their commitment to 100% natural colour, present in each and every Macallan single malt.  This non-age statement range of Speyside single malts concentrates on colour; the theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Springbank - 7 Year Old Organic​ 1992 Da Mhile
DESCRIPTION:
Springbank, Organic???
The first organic whisky approved by The Soil Association. 
Distilled in June 1992 and matured in oak casks before the 1000 limited edition bottles were released in September 1999.
This is bottle number 5.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10 year old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the first release in the series.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Loch Dhu  - 10 Year Old The Black Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
Loch Dhu 10 Year Old Black Whisky.
This black malt is of divided opinion in the whisky community. The origin of its dark nature is either one of a fairytale or simply caramel colouring.
Produced at Mannochmore there is no doubt, with this whisky becoming increasing hard to find, it is becoming very collectable.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Years Old - Single Cask Series Aberdeen Airport #3631
DESCRIPTION: This Highland Park Single Cask Edition was bottled in 2018 exclusively for Aberdeen International Airport and World of Whiskies.  With just 610 bottles available, the 12-year-old single malt whisky is drawn from an intriguing mix of American/Spanish oak cask and bottled at a cask strength 64.4% ABV.

This 2017 Special Releases is a blended malt and the first time one has been included in the series.  Collectivum XXVIII exceeds expections, and is an expertly blended expression that includes malt from every single operational Diageo distillery (28).

A Strathmill, from 1994 and bottled by Carn Mor.
It is part of the Celebration of the Cask series. Distilled on the 9 July 94 and bottled on 23 April 2018 @ 23 years old. A single sherry hogshead was used to create an great combination of sherry cask richness and spice. 
One of only 316 bottles.
This is bottle number 216.

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 44. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hazelburn - 10 Year Old - Rum Caslk - Cadenhead's
DESCRIPTION: A very limited 10 year old, matured in Barbados Rum Casks before being bottled in July 2011. This is one of just 240 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10-year-old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the first release in the series, released for Feis Ile 2010.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.
This bottle comes with its own black carry case.

DESCRIPTION:
The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.
This bottle comes with its own black carry case.
A long discontinued 12 Year Old from the Scapa Distillery in Orkney.  It was matured for 12 years in clifftop warehouses overlooking the beautiful waters of the Scapa Flow.

DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.
