DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Jura - 20 Year Old - All and One
DESCRIPTION:
'One and all' follows on from 'One For The Road' which was released to celebrate the retirement of Willie Cochrane after 39 years of service.
This twenty year old was produced with freshly filled Bourbon barrels and malt that has been aged in Sherry Wood, Sparkling Cabernet Franc Cask, Cabernet Sauvignon Casks and Pinot Noir Barriques.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2018 and includes double matured Laphroaig from ex bourbon barrels then Fino Sherry Casks. These special casks have been stored in Warehouse 8 and 10.
It was bottled at 51.8% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Speyburn - 7 Year Old - That Boutique-y Whisky Company
DESCRIPTION:
This release combines the first independent bottling from Speyburn Distillery and the 100th different line by That Boutique-y Whisky Company.
The bottle label illustration features an educated salmon teaching the Victorian gentlemen, Speyburn is "Never smoother! None better! The world's finest! Simply incredible!" - it is inspired by unofficial brand ambassador Jan Birch's theory that Speyburn owes its unique flavour to the Victorian Salmon Cannon used in its production.
Batch 1 is a release of 233 bottles. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 65.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This bottling was originally aged in ex-bourbon barrels before being re-casked in Madeira seasoned traditional hogsheads. It was bottled at 51.6% ABV.

Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
 
Drawn from a single barrel, number 602, which was stored on rick number 56. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.

Blanton's are famous for producing the first single barrel bourbon in the USA.
Drawn from a single barrel, number 602, which was stored on rick number 56. Each bottling is individually selected, filtered and bottled by hand.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

This 12 Year Old limited-edition of Ardmore bottled in 1999 to celebrate the distillery's centenary.
Rated a 94 in Jim Murray's whisky bible.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle released by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This expression was bottled in 2018 and includes double matured Laphroaig from ex-bourbon barrels then Fino Sherry Casks. These special casks have been stored in Warehouse 8 and 10.
It was bottled at 51.8% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength, Quarter cask American Oak matured single malt. The smaller casks give greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.
This striking older-style presentation of Bowmore 10 Year Old single malt from the now highly sought screened label bottlings that were released between 1990 and 1995.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilkerran - 8 Year Old Sherry Wood Open Day 2016
DESCRIPTION:
A special Campbeltown single malt aged for 8 years in Shery wood exclusivly. 
It was bottled at cask strength @ 56.4% for the distillery's Open Day in 2016.

A 12 year old Glenfiddich with a twist - the malted barley is dried using peat to produce a more characterful, smoky flavour - its name “Caoran” is from the Gaelic for Peat Ember.  Although a resounding success since its launch, this is a discontinued bottling.

Triple cask matured for more than 15 years in bourbon, sherry and Marsala casks.  This is the third entry in the Spot range of single pot still whiskeys. 
The Red Spot name came from the family's practice of marking casks of different ages with a spot of paint with a different colour.

This is a very nicely presented bottle of 21-year-old blended whisky from Whyte & Mackay, which is believed to be produced in the 1980's. The bottle comes with a metallic tag that hangs from the neck of the decanter. It also comes in a beautiful silky lined wooden presentation box.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - 15 Year Old - The Renaissance Chapter 3
DESCRIPTION:
Glen Garioch Chapter 3 of 4 is This 17 year old and part of a limited release of The Renaissance Series.
Each bottle is said to tell a different part of the start-up of the once closed distillery back in 1997.

A classic from the Orkney distillery in the slightly older packaging.
Haven't tried this dram? Now is the time... full of depth and smoke whilst being quoted as being "the Best Spirit in the World"... Highland Park.

Distilled in 2005, this Longmorn was bottled in 2019.
These labels are exclusive to G&M. This series is all about how the distillers only allowed official bottlings. However, this has now changed with time and what a great job G&M have made!

Time has mellowed but not tamed this powerful 18 year old Talisker, made beside Loch Harport in the shadow of the Cuillin range. A rich, sweet nose introduces familiar, smoky maritime aromas. Full-bodied, this smooth malt open sweetly, then becomes more assertive, with a whiff of smoke. It has an unmistakeable, richly warming finish, more subtle here than in the 10 year old.

One of only 571 bottles drawn at cask strength from a first fill bodega sherry butt cask. It was bottled in 2006 and is of all-natural colour.
Cask No: 3671... Isn't she great!
Bottle Number 295 of 571.
This 15 year old Springbank is the old style presentation.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Craigellachie - 1978 - 19 Year Old - Master Of Malt
DESCRIPTION: A 19 year old single malt whisky that was distilled in 1978 at Craigellachie Distillery in Speyside and bottled by The Master of Malt.

The Spirit of Speyside Festival, in the heart of Scotland, occurs annually and hosts people that travel from all over the world to visit and partake in distillery tours & tastings.
Mortlach released this bottle for the Spirit of Speyside Festival 2013, which is a limited edition and a combination of hand-picked casks to represent the special aspects of Mortlach.

This is a limited-edition Macallan 12 Year Old.  The photography on this gift box was inspired by the story behind the exceptional sherry seasoned oak casks that were used to mature this whisky.  This release was available in Taiwan.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Scapa - 13 Year Old - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: This Douglas Laing Old Malt cask Scapa was distilled in February 1991. It was matured in single cask DL REF 1261, before being bottled at 13 years of age in August 2004. This is one of just 339 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 9 Year Old - Renaissance - Fèis Ìle 2011
DESCRIPTION: The Renaissance from Bruichladdich was distilled in September 2001 and was bottled at 9 years old for Fèis Ìle 2011. The maturation period was in a bourbon cask and 2,500 bottles were produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #011
DESCRIPTION:
This original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
This release was bottled at 58.6% in May 19.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Strathisla - 19 Year Old - 1994 Cask Strength Batch #12
DESCRIPTION:
Originally released exclusively for sale at Chivas distilleries, this cask-strength bottle of Strathisla was distilled in 1994 and bottled in 2013 at 19 years old.
This is a limited bottling from batch No SI 19 012.

Milsean was the seventh release in Glenmorangie's Private Edition series. It was finished for two-and-a-half years in 154 toasted ex-Portuguese-red-wine barriques. This highland malt is sweet with notes of tropical fruit and lemon sherbet, backed up with some ginger spice.
'Milsean' is Gaelic for 'sweet things.'

The Distillers Edition is a special release from Talisker, the single malt was double matured with a finishing period in a sweet amoroso cask-wood. 
The limited-edition bottle was distilled in 2000 and bottled at 45.8%.
The Distillers Edition Series features a small number of casks from 6 distilleries that were hand-selected for double maturing.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Black Friday - 21 Year Old - Whisky Exchange III 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The third release from The Whisky Exchange and their Black Friday bottling. It sold out in 11 minutes because it an outstanding dram. It was bottled at cask strength...
Last year’s release was a Highland Park (unofficial) and this year an older undisclosed Speyside 21 Year Old year old was chosen.
They did disclose that the distillery was founded as early as 1810, located between Forres and Elgin and rarely seen as a single malt whisky.
Glen Burgie?????

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...
Balvenie Signature 12 Year Old Batch 4 was the penultimate release in Balvenie Signature range. It was matured in three most traditional cask types Sherry, Bourbon and Refill casks.
A rare and discontinued 1990s Glenmorangie Port Wood Finish.  Aged for at least 12 years in American oak casks before being finished in Port pipes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.

Auchentoshan's release of the 'Three Wood' was hugely popular and this is where it all began. This is the original bottling which has been matured in a combination of American bourbon, Spanish Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez.

Looking great in its new packaging wouldnt you agree? The Arran 18 has undergone a bit of rebranding in 2019. However, Aaran fans, please dont worry, the whisky that is inclosed within still remains the same. 
Handpicked from the island's warehouses sherry casks.
This special release commemorates 175 years of Talisker Distillery. It was a limited release of 60,000 bottles, bottled in 2005.
What a stoater! This SMWS is a 13-year-old Dalmore, matured in a first-fill sherry butt. bottled at 62.7%. This is one of only 815 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Glenrothes - 13 Year Old  - Halloween Edition 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenrothes Halloween Edition 2019 is a limited release of only 5,000 bottles, with a theme of ‘Ghosts and Guising’. Ghosts and spirits are entwined with the long history of The Glenrothes: our distillery is situated on an ancient leyline, next to the Rothes graveyard, and has records of our very own hauntings.
This bottle comes with its own black carry case.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Cairdeas - Cask Strength Quarter Cask 2017
DESCRIPTION:
Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members. 
This 2017 bottling is a cask strength Quarter cask, matured in American Oak. the smaller casks gives greater contact with the wood and a more intense maturation.

This beautiful distillery is a neighbour to the Queen's highland castle at Balmoral. A very small distillery with only two copper pot stills.
This particular bottling was a vatting of first fill European Oak casks personally selected by the staff at Royal Lochnagar. 
It is one of only 4000 bottles.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

This 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Classic Malts range.  
This commemorative cask strength release was bottled in 1998 marking a centenary of the distillery.

Produced from the unspoiled land of Islay, this beautiful malt has been aged for 18 years in the famous Vaults. Bowmore is in the heart of the island and on the shore of Loch Indaal.
Regarded as one of the most balanced whiskies in the world, this expression has a wonderfully creamy nose with a complex palate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...

An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15 Year Old.
This style of bottle is becoming harder and harder to find every year.
Voted distillery of the year in 2001 by Malt Advocate and this malt took home the gold from Stockholm Whisky festival in 2001.

Bottled in 1993 and distilled in 1984, this Bladnoch from Gordon and MacPhail is part of the popular Connoisseurs Choice range.
This range did very well and it has proved to hugely popular for more than 35 years.
This bottle of Knockando Extra Old Reserve was seasoned in 1964 and bottled in 1988.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

SMWS 53.275 Caol Ila 10 Year Old.
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
From the wonderful whisky Island of Islay comes this 10 year old whisky from Caol Ila. Only 253 bottles were produced from the Refill Ex-bourbon Hogshead.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - A Midwinter Night's Dram (First Release)
DESCRIPTION:
This 2015 limited edition of A Midwinter Night's Dram marks Glenmorangie's first bottling in the resurrection of an old tradition: at the end of each year, their master distiller would create a special single malt for a treat for The Sixteen Men of Tain, to say thank you for all their hard work.
This single malt features whisky drawn from select bourbon casks and Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks, resulting in an expression full of Christmas spices, sweet fruit and nutty elements.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - 21 Year Old - Royal Salute - Emerald Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Emerald-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Double Cask - 2019 Special Edition
DESCRIPTION:
This 12 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 12 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Special Edition - the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars, has inspired the distinctive design of this special edition gift box. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.
This Aberfeldy single malt was distilled in March 1998 and matured in a refill sherry hogshead cask. It was bottled in September 2004 by Gordon & MacPhail for their Connoisseurs Choice range.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Talisker - Select Reserve - Game of Thrones - House of GreyJoy
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Talisker, a costal distillery with signature maritime character, has been perfectly paired with House Greyjoy, that rules over the Iron Islands and worship the Drowned God.  
This Talisker is aged in heavily charred, ex-bourbon American oak casks for a truly unique character.
This lot includes 4 x 20cl bottles:

Produced from the unspoiled land of Islay, this beautiful malt has been aged for 18 years in the famous Vaults. Bowmore is in the heart of the island and on the shore of Loch Indaal.
Regarded as one of the most balanced whiskies in the world, this expression has wonderfully creamy nose with a complex palate.
This Royal Lochnagar Highland single malt Scotch whisky was matured in 1st Fill European Oak Casks.  This limited 2017 was exclusively available at the distillery visitor centre.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich  - Clan of The Highlands - MacPherson
DESCRIPTION:
A collectable Glenfiddich single malt Scotch whisky from the 1980s in a Clans Of The Scottish Highlands presentation tin featuring Clan MacPherson.
This is a 70cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Cardhu Gold Reserve - Game of Thrones - House Targaryen
DESCRIPTION: This bottle of Cardhu Gold Reserve 'House Targaryen' is part of the Game of Thrones collection by Diageo.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 18 Year Old - Deep and Complex
DESCRIPTION:
Bowmore 18 Year Old matured in PX and Oloroso Sherry Casks.
This is part of their core range, however, this should not take away from this dram. It was released as part of the "Exclusive to the Global Traveller" range.
Only for the Deep and Complex few...

The first of two special releases to mark the acquisition and rebirth of Bruichladdich distillery at Feis Ile 2011.  This single malt is 12 years old and was distilled in 1998 under the previous ownership. This is one of just 2,500 individually numbered bottles, 100% matured in bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 15 Year Old - 200th Anniversary Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited release 15-year-old Laphroaig single malt was bottled to commemorate Laphroigs 200th Anniversary.  To mark their bicentenary they brought back their 15-Year-Old for a limited edition release.  Laphroaig 15 Year Old was first released in the 1980s, but it was eventually replaced with the Laphroaig 18 Year Old.
A highly collectable bottle of Bunnahabhain 12 year old single malt. This an older style bottling.
Distilled in 1984, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1997 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%.

This was the Bowmore festival bottling for Fèis Ìle 2013. It was matured in bourbon cask strength and was bottled at 56.5% and non-chill-filtered.
This is bottle number 50.

One of only 257 bottles and lots of smoke on the nose, this 20 year old is from Miltonduff Speyside.
The spirit was matured in a Refill Ex-Bourbon Hogshead.
SMWS code - 72.19 Soot and ash.

The Laphroaig Lore is made up of a variety of aged casks such as sheer casks, quarter casks & reused peated casks. This bottle provides an initial classic rich, peaty taste and concludes with a spicy chili bite and extended sweet aftertaste.

The Platinum Label is a relatively new addition to the Johnnie Walker collection. 
Originally released for travel retail, the Platinum Label (the first new 'colour' to be introduced into the Johnnie Walker range for years).

This 2008 vintage Benromach was bottled in 2019 after a decade maturing in first-fill bourbon and sherry casks. This delicately smoky dram is said to be replacing 100° Proof in the Bemromach Classic Range.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.

Bottled at cask strength after being matured in Sherry casks from Spain, this is batch number 63. This bottling line is based upon a tradition that dates back to the 19th century when people from the surrounding towns went to the distillery to collect their "dram".

This 2008 vintage Benromach was bottled in 2019 after a decade maturing in first-fill bourbon and sherry casks. This delicately smoky dram is said to be replacing 100° Proof in the Bemromach Classic Range.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.
Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban is matured in bourbon casks before finishing in the finest Ruby Port casks from the "Quintas" or wine estates of Portugal. Ruban is Gaelic for Ruby.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Linkwood - 15 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail
DESCRIPTION:
A Speyside classic from Linkwood / Gordon Macphail. 
Bottled after 15 years of maturation, these labels are exclusive to G&M. This series is all about how the distillers only allowed official bottlings. However, this has now changed with time and what a great job G&M have made!
Glenfiddich's 18-year-old Ancient Reserve single malt whisky. This edition comes in the  Glenfiddich livery rather than the decanters used in the early 1990s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Kilchoman - 2008 - Islay Pipe Band Single Cask 2013
DESCRIPTION:
Kilchoman Distillery has sponsored the Islay Pipe Band since 2012 and this sponsorship has taken the form of a cask of whisky selected by John MacLellan, bottled and sold from the distillery with all the proceeds going to the Pipe Band.
Cask 461 / 2008

This lot includes 5 x 5cl bottles of  Laphroaig - Quarter Cask.
A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

This is a unique blend from the finest and oldest selection of whiskies that Chivas have to offer.
"It will grace the table of any connoisseur"

This a 10 year old Macallan 5cl miniature bottle. 
Macallan is arguably the most collectable malt in the world.  There has also been a real shift towards miniature whiskies in the Asian market recently which could make this lot very collectable indeed.

A combination of Sherry seasoned American oak and European oak casks was used to mature this single malt.  It is part of the Warrier Series by Highland Park which was created exclusively for Duty-Free.  
This edition is named after one of the most important figures in the history of the Vikings, Harald - was central to the founding of the Orkney Earldom.

This gift set includes 4 x Glenfarclas branded glassed and a 75cl bottling of Glenfarclas 8-year-old single malt whisky from the 1980s.
From the heart of Speyside, this little tipple is a great talking point.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

This Cragganmore was distilled in 1990 and was released as part of the Distillers Edition series. It was bottled in 2013 after being finished in Port Casks.
CggD-6565.

This gist set includes a 70cl bottle of Dalmore 15 Year Old and 2 x branded glasses in an attractive gift set.
This Dalmore 15-year-old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further 3-year maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.

From the shores of Islay this 15 year old whisky was matured in both bourbon barrels and sherry oak barrels.
These casks came from North America and Spain before arriving at their new home in Islay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich  - Clan of The Highlands - Montgomerie
DESCRIPTION:
A collectable Glenfiddich single malt Scotch whisky from the 1980s in a Clans Of The Scottish Highlands presentation tin featuring Clan Montgomerie
This is a 70cl bottling.

A GlenAllachie special release, this is a 12 year old, Spirit of Speyside Festival edition.  Bottled at 58.9% ABV, it was originally distilled in 2006 before residing in a sherry butt No. 897, resulting in an outturn of 1028 bottles due to the 50cl size. These were hand signed by Billy Walker, Master Distiller and sold during the festival. 
This is bottle number 427 out of 1028 produced.

Still part of the core range down in Campletown, just slightly older packaging.
The distillery has been making somewhat of a come back lately with collectors scrambling to get their hands on some of their sublime malts. 
Springbank 15...lovely just lovely.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2%, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.
Distilled in 1979, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1997 by Justerini & Brooks at 40%. This is a 1L.

Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from barrel #120.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bladnoch - 16 Year Old - Spirit of the Lowands (35cl)
DESCRIPTION: This is a 35cl bottling of 16-Year-Old single malt from Bladnoch Distillery - Spirit of the Lowlands'
This Arran single malt early bottling of no age statement Arran single malt, made available only to the initial bondholders - the investors in Arran Distillery, making it very rare!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - Game of Thrones - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited-edition 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar and it is part of Diagio's 2018 collaboration with HBO.  Each single malt in the series relates to the land of houses of the Game of Thrones television series.  The Royal Lochnagar bottle is decorated with a rampant black Stag, the sigil of House Baratheon that once flew on banners above the Stormlands and King’s Landing signifying absolute power.

Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from barrel a bourbon barrel.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.

Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from barrel a bourbon barrel.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.

Without chill-filtration or additional colouring, this bottling was drawn from barrel #120.
Blanton's are known for their top-quality bourbon and this bottling is no different.

The Bowmore Tempest 10 Year Old. This is the 6th release of the popular cask strength Islay expression.
It has been matured in first fill bourbon casks.
Said to have tropical fruits and layers of sweet almonds and an ocean breeze.

This special release is the Diageo The Directors' Blend. It is a blended Scotch whisky, bottled in December 2005 and gifted exclusively to Diageo employees in recognition of their exceptional contribution. It is made up of whiskies from all of Diageo's 29 distilleries including, 27 malt distilleries and 2 grain distilleries.

Step aside, Benromach coming through! An older expression from the Speyside distillery. Using only the finest ingredients from the heart of Scotlands single malt country, its beautifully balanced with a hint of smoke.

One for the golfers out there, this bottle was selected especially for the Machrihanish Golf Club.
This Glen Scotia single cask was bottled in 2019 and was distilled in 2006.
Only 196 bottles came from the "Wee Toon".

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.
This Dalwhinnie is a limited edition no-age-statement Dalwhinnie, exclusively available at the Distillery.  Only 6,000 bottles were released.
This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich is a pre-closure edition from Whyte & Mackay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 13 Year Old - Gordon & Macphail
DESCRIPTION:
This is an independently bottled Caol Ila 13 Year Old by Gordon & MacPhail, released as part of a their "Discovery" range.
It was introduced in 2018.  The embossed glass certainly adds to its expensive feel.

Enigma is a 12 Year Old bottling released by Bowmore, originally bottled for Travel Retail. Enigma is an unusual expression for Bowmore as a greater amount of fresh sherry casks have been used over its 12 years of maturation.

This is a 70cl Litre bottle of Glenfarclas 105 Cask Strength (60%) matured in sherry casks. 
This is an older release, presented in a tall black and gold tube.
Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan.  The casks used for this expression include Mizunara Japanese oak and Bourdeaux wine casks.
A smart old bottle of Laphroaig, bottled before the Royal Warrant in 1994. Laphroaig 15 Year Old is smoother than the robust 10-year-old. This is a half bottle - 33.33cl
Distilled in 1987 an older bottling from the Highland distillery.
A popular blended malt produced by Morrisons Bowmore Distillers Limited.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hazelburn - 10 Year Old Open Day 2013 - 2003 Bourbon Barrels
DESCRIPTION:
Hazelburn - 10 Year Old Open Day 2013 - 2003 Bourbon Barrels 
A cracking 10 year old single cask Hazelburn which matured in a single fresh bourbon barrel.
Bottled: 23rd May 2013
This was for the Springbank Open Day and only 218 bottles were released at cask strength.
The Springbank Open Day became part of the wider Campbeltown Malts Fetival the following year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - 9 Year Old - Game of Thrones - House Lannister
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo collaborated with HBO to release a limited-edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
This 9-year-old Islay single malt from Lagavulin represents the House Lannister - one of the richest and oldest dynasties in the Seven Kingdoms. This 9 year old was matured exclusively in first-fill ex-bourbon casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton Glendullan - Game of Thrones - House of Tully
DESCRIPTION: The Singleton Glendullan Reserve hails from Dufftown distillery. Glendullan is located on the banks of the River Fiddich, so it has been cleverly paired with House Tully at Riverrun, which is in the region known as The Riverlands. This single malt Scotch whisky is decorated with a jumping trout - the sigil of House Tully.
This is a litre bottling of Famous Grouse - 1987 Vintage, which was relased following the success of the 1986 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

Glen Ord distillery is just outside of Muir of Ord in the Highlands of Scotland. This malt won best single malt of the year IWSC Gold medal for two consecutive years. 
This now-discontinued bottling was matured in Sherry oak casks for 12 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Oban - The Night's Watch - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
Part of Diageo's original release of eight bottlings - one for each season of the show. (Although there are now 12 releases in total).
Eight different distilleries from different Scottish regions represent a Game of Thrones House and respective crest.
This Oban represents the Night's watch, who were the Keepers of the Wall.
This Dalmore 15 year old was matured for 12 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks and then a further maturation in three different sherry casks: Amoroso, Apostoles and Matusalem Oloroso.

This is a Dalmore 12 Year Old from the 1990s with the old style packaging.
This bottle has been matured in American white oak and Oloroso sherry butts.

A mystery Island distillery from Adelphi which has a great history which originated from Glasgow.
Only 309 bottles were produced of this 13 year old single malt.

A multi-vintage Bruichladdich, matured in bourbon casks and further maturation in Grenache wine casks. Released in 2007, this expression was the first edition of the Bruichladdich Rocks bottling series which began in 2007, with the final realise in 2011.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - PX Cask - Handfill (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: This is a 20cl hand-filled exclusive bottling from warehouse 9 at Bunnahabhain.  It has been filled from cask #1635, a 12-year-old PX Butt.

This Dalwhinnie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1988 before being bottled in 2003. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured.
Batch D.SK.312
This cask strength Bowmore was originally bottled for the travel retail market. This is a 1L bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Janneau  - Grand Armagnac VSOP  - 1970s (with 2 x Glasses)
DESCRIPTION:
From the iconic Armagnac producer Janneau, this is a 1970s bottling of their Fondateur VSOP.
Named after Janneau's founder, Pierre Etienne Janneau, it features his portrait on the label.
This set also includes 2 x glasses. This is a 75cl bottling.

Still part of the core range down in Campletown, just slightly older packaging.
The distillery has been making somewhat of a come back lately with collectors scrambling to get their hands on some of their sublime malts. 
Springbank 10...lovely just lovely.
Diurachs is Gaelic for the people of Jura. This 16 year old from the Isle of Jura was a bronze medal winner at the 2004 International Wine and Spirits Competition.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

To make The Balvenie DoubleWood, The Balvenie Malt Master David Stewart MBE takes whisky that has spent at least 12 years in traditional whisky casks, American Oak ex-bourbon barrels and hogsheads, and moves it to Spanish oak ex-Oloroso sherry casks for an additional nine months.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.
Bas Armagnac Baron de St Feux, 1986.

This 8 year old was released in 2016 to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Lagavulin distillery by John Johnston in 1816.  This single malt is smoky, with underlying sweet spice. It was inspired by the visit of Alfred Barnard to the distillery in the 1880s when he tried an 'exceptionally fine' eight-year-old from the distillery, making this a very fitting tribute for the milestone occasion.

From the Isle of Skye Talisker 10 Year Old from the 1990s.This older style of the packaging features the Isle of Skye mapped on a stone. 
Talisker was originally formed in 1930 by Kenneth and Hugh Macaskill.   The two gentlemen are in fact brothers. The fire in November 1960 resulted in a new distillery being built which included two new stills. Now part of Diagio classic malt line up, a great one for island collectors and lovers of the Isle of Skye.

Moch is Gaelic for 'dawn' - it is a much lighter expression than their 12 year old.
Caol Ila Moch is the first single malt from the distillery to be selected entirely on the basis of its taste, rather than age, cask wood, strength or finish.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.4
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10 year old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the fourth release in the series.

The Bowmore Darkest has been matured in Bourbon casks initially, but the final three years the single malt spent in Oloroso sherry casks gives the whisky its rich, deep colour.  This 15 year old was bottled at 43% abv.

This Campbeltown set which contains 3 great single malts -
1x - Longrow Peated 46% 0.2L
1x - Springbank 10 year old 46% 0.2L
1x - Hazelburn Campbeltown 12 YO 46% 0.02L

This 8 year old was released in 2016 to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the founding of Lagavulin distillery by John Johnston in 1816.  This single malt is smoky, with underlying sweet spice. It was inspired by the visit of Alfred Barnard to the distillery in the 1880s when he tried an 'exceptionally fine' eight-year-old from the distillery, making this a very fitting tribute for the milestone occasion.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 13 Year Old Hand Filled - Moine Oloroso Finish (20cl)
DESCRIPTION:
A 20cl, 13-year-old mini bottling from Warehouse 9 which was hand filled at Bunnahabhain distillery.
This peated malt was from cask #AR13000007 and finished in Oloroso sherry wood.

This 10 Year Old Bunnahabhain was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of their Discovery range.
Notes of vanilla, toffee and light fruit.
Glenrothes Robur Reserve was released as a travel retail exclusive, named for European of Spanish oak, Quercus Robur. Matured with a good proportion of first fill Oloroso sherry casks.
This lot includes 6 x Orkney minis:

The distillery is said to be the birthplace of distilling on Islay. The rich and intenseness of the flavours infuse the senses with delight.
A travel exclusive from the Islay company, in Port Ellen Isle of Islay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 10 Year Old - Tempest - Batch No.3
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in first-fill bourbon casks, this is a very popular 10-year-old release from the Islay giant, Bowmore Distillery.
This is the third release in the series.
This 8 Year Old Glendronach was matured and married in a combination of the finest bourbon & sherry casks.
Tamdhu 10 Year Old is the first release in their maturing range of whiskies. Matured exclusively in sherry oak casks for 10 long years gives this Tamdhu bottling its glorious natural colour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dalwhinnie - Winters Frost - Game of Thrones - House of Stark
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo have collaborated with HBO to release a limited edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
The lords of House Stark ruled as King in the North for generations, in the vast cold expanse of the northern lands of Westeros. The Stark's resilience, strength and ability to thrive in the most intense situations are greatly shaped by Winterfell's frigid temperatures. Like House Stark, Dalwhinnie is made in one of the highest and coldest distilleries in Scotland, and its extreme conditions are responsible for shaping its signature flavour.
Matured in 100% ex-bourbon casks, this Highland single malt has a uniquely floral, honeyed character. The palate has rich manuka honey and fresh figs, developing into malt balls before a rich fruit cake finish.

This is the second release of Ailsa Bay's Sweet Smoke - it has had a redesign from its first release. The 1.2 is said to be both smokier and sweeter than before. It scientifically distilled to 022 parts peat and 019 parts sweet.
This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Janneau  - Grand Armagnac VSOP  - 1970s (with 2 x Glasses)
DESCRIPTION:
From the iconic Armagnac producer Janneau, this is a 1970s bottling of their Fondateur VSOP.
Named after Janneau's founder, Pierre Etienne Janneau, it features his portrait on the label.
This set also includes 2 x glasses. This is a 75cl bottling.
Distilled in 1987, this Knockando single malt was bottled in 1999 by Justerini & Brooks at 43%.

Released in early 2019, this 12-year-old single malt from Tobermory was launched in celebration of the distillery returning to life after a two-year hiatus. It was matured in American oak casks, before being bottled at 46.3% ABV.
This Ballantine's 17-Year-Old bottling is from the 1990s.  Matured in oak casks and bottled by Ballantine & Son Limited distillers. This is a 75cl.

This is a 70 cl bottling of Laphroaig Triple wood.  It was originally launched for the duty-free market but the Triple Wood has become a core expression from Laphroaig.  The single malt has been triple matured; in bourbon barrels, quarter casks and then Oloroso sherry butts.

From J&B's, A vintage bottling from the Speyside distillery, Knockando.
Bottled in 1995 and distilled in 1980.

Still part of the core range down in Campletown, just slightly older packaging.
The distillery has been making somewhat of a come back lately with collectors scrambling to get their hands on some of their sublime malts. 
Springbank 10...lovely, just lovely.
This Jura single malt was distilled in 1991 and bottled in 2003 for Gordon & MacPhail's Connoisseurs Choice range.

A classic version of the 12-year-old expression by Glenlivet. The distillery was the first in the Highlands to be granted a license under the act of 1823.
They say their secret is the crystal clear water and the Highland air.

This 10 Year Old Bunnahabhain was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of their Discovery range.
Notes of vanilla, toffee and light fruit.

This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.

One of only 2840 bottles produced white oak casks. This single malt whisky was bottled by the New Zealand Malt Whisky Company Limited.
Distilled in 1990 and bottled in October 2002 it is said to have a muscular character, with a smooth dry finish.
This is an older style 12-year-old,  bottled in the 1980s by Glenturret.  This entry-level bottling was discontinued in 2003, when it was replaced by the 10 year-old.

10,000 bottles were produced of this Kilchoman Autumn 2009 release which was only the second release from the distillery.
3 years in bourbon casks and finished in Oloroso sherry casks. Just to top it off a 3 year old refill bourbon barrel was added to the vatting.

Benromach Peat Smoke was distilled in 2008.
It's part of a small number of batches, that include peat, from the Speyside distillery.
47ppm of peat and notes of liquorice, orange or grapefruit.
This is a litre bottling of Famous Grouse - 1992 Vintage, which was relased following the success of the 1989 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

Haig Dimple blended Whisky, also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.
This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.
A mystery single malt from Islay - distilled and matured at Bruichladdich Distillery.

Glenrothes 11 Year Old discovery bottled by Gordon & MacPhail for the Discovery bottling series. Three categories are used in this series -
This dram comes under the sherried whisky category and is full of fruity and chocolatey notes.

A limited release from Bowmore in a 9 Year Old Sherry and Bourbon Cask.
Lots of interest regarding this bottle due to the unusual age statement.
The No.1 Vaults bringing another surprise for the Islay lovers!

Valkyrie is the first of Highland Park’s new Viking Legend series.  Valknut & Valhalla are the other releases in this series. 
Matured in a combination of first-fill American oak sherry, Bourbon and Spanish oak sherry casks and some refill casks. The packaging design was created by Danish designer Jim Lyngvild with inspiration drawn from the ancient Hammer Stone of Gotland and a Viking pendant from Upland, Sweden.
This single malt was awarded The Chairman’s Trophy in the 2017 Ultimate Spirits Challenge, scoring 99 out of 100.

A 16 year old single malt expression from Tomintoul.
It has been matured in bourbon casks and crafted by the fourth generation distiller, Robert Fleming.
This lot is now discontinued it is a 12 year old light style whisky from Fettercairn.

A 10 year old malt whisky distilled in the time honoured traditions from the ancient whisky craft and carefully matured in fine oak casks. The distinctive flavour is born in the snow capped Lammerlaw Mountains deep in the south of New Zealand and thr sweet pure mountain water found there used to create this unique malt whisky.

From the Speyside distillery, Glenfiddich, this is their Experimental Series. The single malt was finished in bespoke craft IPA barrels. This pioneering malt is imbued with unique zesty citrus notes and the subtle tang of fresh hops.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

Old Pulteney 12 year old whisky has won many awards. It boasts lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
This is an older bottle from the late 1990s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

Part of the core range of products from Kilkerran. IT has been matured for 12 years
Kilkerran is derived from the gaelic "Caen Loch Cille Chiarain" which is h name of the original settlement where Saint Kieran had his religious cell.

The ten-year-old Edradour is handmade and one of the last Single Malt Whiskies from a traditional farm distillery still in production today.
Edradour story is most certainly one of a kind. It is owned by a gentleman called Andrew Symington who also owns the independent bottling company Signatory. Even the Mafia, Frank Costello was a representative of the company.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - Palo Cortado - Handfill (20cl)
DESCRIPTION: This is a 20cl hand-filled exclusive bottling from warehouse 9 at Bunnahabhain.  It has been filled from cask #16, a 12-year-old Palo Cortado.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - 12 Year Old - Black Label - 200th Anniversary Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 100th anniversary of Johnnie Walker Black Label, in 2009, this special edition 12 year old Johnnie Walker has a striking black bottle and presentation box-frame .
Johnnie Walker Black Label's iconic square bottle makes it one of the world's most recognisable whiskies.  It is a blend of around 40 whiskies.
This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich comes complete with old style presentation tin tube.  This has now been replaced by 'Laddie Ten'.

This Glenkinchie Distillers Edition was distilled in 1989 before being bottled in 2003. This single malt whisky of the Classic Malts Selection was double matured in cask-wood.
Batch G/277-7-D
Distilled in 1990, matured in refill sherry hogsheads before bottling in 2006 by Gordon and MacPhail. Ledaig is the name given to peaty releases from the Tobermory distillery on the Isle of Mull.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Grants - Finest Scotch Whisky - Matchbox Whisky
DESCRIPTION:
William Grant, also the founder of Glenfiddich, launched his company in 1898 and claims the record for longest family run whisky making distillery in Scotland.
70° Proof.
Distilled in 1991, this Knockando single malt was matured for 12 years and bottled at 43%.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Arran Malt - 12 Year Old - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION: This 12 Year Old Arran single malt is part of their core range. Bottled at natural cask strength of at 53.9% in September 2013. One of 15,000 and from batch Number 3.
This 12 year old is a  flagship bottling from the Lowland Glenkinchie distillery - it replaces the 10 year-old as the main expression of the Lowland style in the Classic Malts range.
A 12 year old single malt from the Speyside distillery, Tormore.  Launched in 2004 this is the distillery's main official bottling.  Tormore is part of the Chivas Brothers portfolio of distilleries.

This Laphroaig has been matured in four different types of casks; virgin American oak barrels, European oak hogsheads, ex-bourbon barrels & small quarter casks. Originally released as a travel retail exclusive

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Scotia - 7 Year Old - 2006 Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This is a Glen Scotia 7-Year-Old, single cask special edition.  It is a limited release of just 241 bottles.  Distilled in Feb 2012, matured in a first fill bourbon barrel cask #82. It is lightly peated to 14.8 ppm, and was bottled in March 2019 at 59.5% av. 
This is the festival edition No.4.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
A bottle of Jura 10 Year Old.  Originally built in 1810, the distillery fell into disrepair and wasn't revived until the 1960's by two local estate owners.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.

A special bottling of malt whiskies from 27 of Diageo's distilleries.  This blend was been produced to commemorate the opening of Diageo's 28th distillery, Roseisle. Roseisle Distillery was officially opened on October 11th 2010.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned.
In 2001, Flora and Fauna released this 10 year old Auchroisk. Until the 2010 release of a 20 year-old, this was the only generally available distillery bottling from this young distillery.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

Matured in first refill American oak and the last year in French oak.
The whisky is said to have a complex nature and bursting with fruitiness finishing with hints of vanilla.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.
This is a 10 year old single malt from Benromach Distillery in Speyside. It was handcrafted by just 2 men, at what was Speyside's smallest distillery.
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore.

With lowland whiskies coming into the spotlight of late, this older style Springbank is starting to become more and more collectable.
Every stage of making the whisky, from malting to bottling, is done on-site at Springbank.
This bottle of Glencadam 15 year old is a special distillery bottling by the Allied Distillers Ltd in Dumbarton.

A superb bottle of 5-star blend.  This bottle was launched after the success of the previous 3-star blend. Both of which have since been discontinued.
The company now belongs to Whyte and Mackay.
A now discontinued 10 year old from Balblair distillery in the North of the Highlands. The air in Edderton on the Dornoch Firth is said to be The Purest in Scotland.
This 10 year old is from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull.  This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glengoyne - 10 Year Old - Art of Glengoyne - Edition 2
DESCRIPTION: A collectable Glengoyne 10 year old.  This "Art of Glengoyne" special edition bottling comes with an eyecatching tin, that depicts a painting of heavy snow at Glengoyne distillery by John Lowrie Morrison.

The 12 year old Triple Cask expression is part of Balvenie's travel retail range. It is made with whisky matured in three different types of cask, namely first-fill American oak barrels, traditional refill casks and first-fill Oloroso Sherry butts. Following the maturation, the whisky is married together to create a cohesive, flavoursome expression packed with orchard fruit, custard cream and cinnamon spice. This is a 20cl bottling.

Strathisla 12 Year Old is a Chivas malt. This malt is finished in ex-sherry barrels and is a highly commended fruity and sherry-rich Speyside single malt. In 2013 it had its packaging revamped to give it a fresh look.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich  - Clan of The Highlands - Montgomerie
DESCRIPTION:
A collectable Glenfiddich single malt Scotch whisky from the 1980s in a Clans Of The Scottish Highlands presentation tin featuring Clan Montgomerie
This is a 70cl bottling.

A special edition blended whisky from Hiram Walker to commemorate Alistair Cunningham's 50th year with the company in 1995. It's not a 50 year old whisky, but instead a blend of 50 malt whiskies and grain from Dumbarton.  This is a 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Masters of Photography - Rankin - Book
DESCRIPTION: This book is a photographic essay of The Macallan Estate, by famous photographer, Rankin.
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore.
Founded in 1870, Chateau de Laubade is an estate in the heart of the Bas Armagnac, the finest of the crus of Armagnac.

This is a 1 Litre bottle of Glenfarclas 105 Cask Strength (60%) matured in sherry casks. 
This is an older release, presented in a tall black and gold tube.

Benromach Organic was distilled in 2011 in Virgin American Oak Casks and then later bottled in 2019. 
Every step of the careful making of this whisky is Certified Organic, this whisky also meets the rigorous UK Soil Association standards regarding growing the ingredients, distillation, maturing and bottling.
A 5 year old single malt from Speyside which is hugely popular in Italy's claiming to be the countries most sought after dram.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.
A 10cl duty paid sample from Balvenie. This sampled was taken in December 2011 from a 15 Year Old Sherry cask.  It comes with 2 x branded glasses.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 12 Year Old - Walker Slater Hip Flask Gift Pack
DESCRIPTION:
A beautiful gift set from GlenDronach, featuring a bottle of GlenDronach 12 Year Old along with a rather lovely hip flask from world-renowned tweed maker Walker Slater.
The 12 Year Old bottle of GlenDronach has been matured in a combination of Pedro Ximinez and Oloroso Sherry Cask and bottled at 43%.

Glenfarclas 8 year old 37.5cl single Highland malt whisky. From the heart of Speyside, this Single Highland Malt is a great talking point. Produced in the legendary Glenfarclas distillery with a global reputation of their Sherried expressions.

Nikka From the Barrel is a blend from The Nikka Whisky Distilling Co.  Matured malt grain whiskies from the Miyagikyo and Yoichi distilleries have been blended and recasked.  The blend won the top prize in its category at the World Whisky Awards in 2007 and 2010.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - 15 Year Old - French Oak Reserve
DESCRIPTION: This 15 year old expression from The Glenlivet, was matured in French Limousin Oak casks. Limousin Oak is a popular choice for the maturation of Cognac.  Glenlivet were one of the first to use French oak for making whisky, a technique that has since been imitated the world over.
Released in 2010 this full-bodied port cask finish is a real credit to the distillery.  Hugely mature and at 50%, this malt is very complex.
This is a lovely 12-year-old bottling from the Aberfeldy Distillery.  It comes with a presentation tube. This 12 Year Old is an excellent introduction to this Highland distillery.

Highland Park 12 Year Old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."
This Glenburgie 15 Year Old is estimated to have been bottled in the 1990s.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks.
Glenburgie 8 Year Old is a trademark of proprietors: J G Stodart Ltd. It was specially selected, produced and bottled by and under responsibility by Gordon & MacPhail.

Handcrafted in Speyside in pot stills, this 12 year old is a classic.
Situated on the outskirts of the Royal Burgh of Elgin on the banks of the River Lossie.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!
This Arran single malt early bottling of no age statement Arran single malt, matured in sherry casks.  This is a long-discontinued edition, released around the millennium.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - A Sensory Journey - Personal Binder
DESCRIPTION: This leather style personal binder depicting The Macallan 'The Sensory Journey.'
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks.

This is an older style bottling of the popular Glenlivet 12-Year-Old, that has been finished in French Limousin Oak casks. Limousin Oak is a popular choice for the maturation of Cognac. Glenlivet were one of the first to use French oak for making Whisky, a technique that has since been imitated the world over.

This Glenfiddich bottling won the Gold Medal at the 2007 International Wine and Spirit Competition.
It has been aged for a total of 12 years in both Oloroso Sherry and Bourbon Cask.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Strathmill - 10 Year Old - Wilson & Morgan - Barrel Selection
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1985, this 10 Year Old Strathmill was bottled by Wilson & Morgan in 1996 as part of their Barrel Selection series.

Ballantine's Vitality, a plentiful, pure grain scotch whisky featuring a revitalising taste and distinctive aroma. The Ballantine Vitality Pure Grain bottle was released as part of the Ballantine's Sensation whiskies, as was the Ballantine Serenity.

Ardmore Traditional Cask is a double cask matured whisky. It was aged in bourbon barrels. The final maturation was in quarter casks to help enrich the whisky due to the smaller size of the cask type. It is a lightly smokey and rich Highland whisky.

Ballantine's Vitality, a plentiful, pure grain scotch whisky featuring a revitalising taste and distinctive aroma. The Ballantine Vitality Pure Grain bottle was released as part of the Ballantine's Sensation whiskies, as was the Ballantine Serenity.
A 1990's bottling of Glengoyne 12 year old single malt.  This is a light and fruity Highland malt.

A limited edition whisky from Johnnie Walker, inspired by the super popular television programme, Game of Thrones.
This new blend features malts from Cardhu and Clynelish and is presented at a strength of 41.7% abv. The bottle has a temperature-sensitive graphic that will spell out the words “Winter is here” when it's at the right temperature for serving.

This is an older style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

This is an older style bottling of Glengoyne 10 year old single malt.
This is a highland malt and somewhat of a favourite in the Asian market.
The first official bottling from Glen Keith.  This 10-year-old was released in the 1990s when the distillery was owned by dearly departed Seagrams.
This lot contains 4 x 5cl & 1 x 3cl miniature bottle:

Old Pulteney 12 year old whisky has won many awards. It boasts lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
This is an older bottle from the late 1990s.

This 10 year old single malt is a great example of some of Fettercairns best whisky, this is an older discontinued botting.  Fettercairn, owned by Whyte and Mackay distillers, is a Highland distillery.

A classic version of the 12-year-old expression by Glenlivet. The distillery was the first in the Highlands to be granted a license under the act of 1823.
They say their secret is the crystal clear water and the Highland air.

This is an older style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.
